pyqgis_plugin.name: QuickWKT
pyqgis_plugin.description: Quick WKT/WKB viewer, this Qgis Plugin opens a dialog where the user can paste (E)WKT and WKB code and see it on the map. Pasted data are stored in a temporay (memory) layer and are completely lost when the user quits QGIS.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Quick WKT/WKB is a plugin to easily show WKT/WKB data into QGIS. It also provides some utilities function and adds them to iface (see the about tab in the plugin's dialog for details).

pyqgis_plugin.name: Html Image Map Plugin
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin generates a HTML-image map file+img from the active point or polygon layer

pyqgis_plugin.name: Memory Layer Saver
pyqgis_plugin.description: Makes layers with memory data providers persistent
pyqgis_plugin.about: Makes layers with memory data providers persistent so that they are restored when a project is closed and reopened. The memory provider data is saved in a portable binary format (QDataStream) that is saved with extension .mldata alongside the project file.

pyqgis_plugin.name: SimpleSvg
pyqgis_plugin.description: Create simple SVG from current view, editable with Inkscape

pyqgis_plugin.name: Vector field renderer
pyqgis_plugin.description: Draw a point layer with arrow symbols
pyqgis_plugin.about: Renders a point layer with arrows representing vectors. The size and orientation of the arrow is data defined. Typically this would be used to represent movement, fluid flow or ground deformation for example. The plugin can also draw an ellipse representing the error covariance of the vector. The scale of the arrows can be easily changed using buttons on the toolbar. The plugin can also draw a scale box on the map showing the magnitude of vectors.

pyqgis_plugin.name: OGR2Layers
pyqgis_plugin.description: Export OGR layers to OpenLayers HTML
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Nicolas BOZON, Rene-Luc D'HONT, Michael DOUCHIN, Luca DELUCCHI

pyqgis_plugin.name: Improved Polygon Capturing
pyqgis_plugin.description: Cad-like polygons and lines digitizing. Numerically lock the angle and/or the length of the next line segment. Maintained by Olivier Dalang. DEPRECATED : please try CadInput instead.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Dockable MirrorMap
pyqgis_plugin.description: Creates a dockable map canvas synchronized with the main one. Developed with funding from Regione Toscana-SITA.
pyqgis_plugin.about: The plugin is able to add one or more extra panels in the main window with additional map canvases. By clicking Add/Remove button on the panel it is possible to add currently selected layers or groups. The additional canvases are synchronized with the main map canvas.

pyqgis_plugin.name: XyTools
pyqgis_plugin.description: Tools for managing tabular data with x y columns
pyqgis_plugin.about: Tools for managing tabular data with x y columns. It can open spreadsheet files (Libre/OpenOffice, Excel) as point layers and save attribute tables as Excel file

pyqgis_plugin.name: Value Tool
pyqgis_plugin.description: Display in a table or plot the values from the visible raster layers at the current mouse position
pyqgis_plugin.about: Display raster layer values at current mouse position

pyqgis_plugin.name: Plugin Builder
pyqgis_plugin.description: Creates a QGIS plugin template for use as a starting point in plugin development
pyqgis_plugin.about: Create a template for a QGIS plugin

pyqgis_plugin.name: GeoCoding
pyqgis_plugin.description: GeoCoding and reverse GeoCoding using Nominatim and Google web services
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin allows the user to search for an address and get its coordinates (geocoding) using GeoCoding using Nominatim and Google web services. It also allows to get the address of a point by clicking on the map canvas (reverse geocoding).

pyqgis_plugin.name: Group Stats
pyqgis_plugin.description: Stats and analysis for vector layers data

pyqgis_plugin.name: TimeManager
pyqgis_plugin.description: create animations visualizing spatio-temporal data
pyqgis_plugin.about: TimeManager adds time controls to QGIS. Using these time controls, you can animate vector features based on a time attribute. There is also an experimental raster layer support and support for interpolation beween point geometries. You can create animations directly in the map window and export image series.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Layers menu from project
pyqgis_plugin.description: Build layers shortcuts menus based on QGis projects
pyqgis_plugin.about: Allow easy opening of layers maintaining their style.

pyqgis_plugin.name: QSpatiaLite
pyqgis_plugin.description: Manage your SpatiaLite databases within QGis

pyqgis_plugin.name: Pin Point
pyqgis_plugin.description: Creates a pin (marker) with an optional description where you click on the map.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Hotlink
pyqgis_plugin.description: Triggers actions on single click to facilitate the use of actions attached to vector layers
pyqgis_plugin.about: When the plugin is activated (button in the toolbar), the objects "carriers" of actions become "clickable".
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Xavier Culos (Agence de l'eau Adour Garonne)

pyqgis_plugin.name: GarminCustomMap
pyqgis_plugin.description: Export the current map canvas to a Garmin Custom Map (.kmz-file)
pyqgis_plugin.about: The GarminCustomMap plugin exports the current map canvas to a .kmz-file, which is compatible with Garmin`s Custom Maps format for handheld GPS units. That way individual maps styled in QGIS can be used as background (raster) maps on the compatible Garmin GPS units, like Alpha, Astro, Dakota, Oregon, Colorado, GPSMAP 62 series, GPSMAP 64 series, GPSMAP 78 series, Edge 800, Montana, Rino, eTrex® 20 and 30.
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Stefan Blumentrath - Norwegian Institute for Nature Research (NINA)

pyqgis_plugin.name: Item Browser
pyqgis_plugin.description: Browse a multiple selection with highlighting of current feature.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Browse a multiple selection with highlighting of current feature.

pyqgis_plugin.name: ScriptRunner

pyqgis_plugin.name: Load Them All
pyqgis_plugin.description: Loads files stored in a directory structure recursively, based on several filters
pyqgis_plugin.about: QGIS plugin that recursively loads vector and raster layers stored in a directory structure, based on several filters.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Remove empty layers from the map
pyqgis_plugin.description: 'Cleans' the layer list widget (legend) by removing empty layers
pyqgis_plugin.about: 'Cleans' the layer list widget (legend) by removing empty layers

pyqgis_plugin.name: Mask
pyqgis_plugin.description: Help to create mask, filter labels in it and automate Atlas generation with mask
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin allows user to quickly transform a polygon selection into a map masking layer or a region of interest, following symbology choice. The plugin allows also to spatially filter labeling of other layer, so that labels will only appear in the Region of Interest.
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Hugo Mercier (Oslandia) - Xavier Culos (Agence de l'eau Adour Garonne) - Régis Haubourg (Agence de l'eau Adour Garonne)

pyqgis_plugin.name: CadTools
pyqgis_plugin.description: Some tools to perform cad like functions in QGIS

pyqgis_plugin.name: Dimensioning
pyqgis_plugin.description: Plugin for dimensioning.

pyqgis_plugin.name: QuickMultiAttributeEdit
pyqgis_plugin.description: QuickMultiAttributeEdit plugin is a quick and handy way to edit an attribute field value for all selected elements in the current/active layer.

pyqgis_plugin.name: lizmap
pyqgis_plugin.description: Publish QGIS maps to the Web via Lizmap Web Client, by 3liz.com
pyqgis_plugin.about: Publish QGIS maps to the Web via Lizmap Web Client, by 3liz.com. Documentation : http://docs.3liz.com

pyqgis_plugin.name: MultiEdit
pyqgis_plugin.description: MultiEdit chooses an attribute value from a vector layer and selecting the matching features, changes all the corresponding to a new value: useful if you have many features to modify.This plugin lets you write the new value in any existing field in the attribute table, for the selected features or newly created from plugin gui...
pyqgis_plugin.about: MultiEdit plugin for Qgis 2.x 2012 © Giuseppe De Marco This plugin is a python plugins that performs changing of attributes values of select features assigning the same value to all the selected item's atribute chosen in plugin gui. Added an options to select all the feature from a layer and set attribute's value to the one chosen in plugin's gui at once.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Profile tool
pyqgis_plugin.description: Plots terrain profile
pyqgis_plugin.about: This tool plots profile lines from raster layers. Supports multiple lines as well as export to svg, pdf, png or csv file. Works with both Qwt5 and Matplotlib plotting libraries.
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Borys Jurgiel - Patrice Verchere - Etienne Tourigny

pyqgis_plugin.name: Loop Visible Layers
pyqgis_plugin.description: Allows for layers or groups to be displayed in a loop

pyqgis_plugin.name: Midvatten
pyqgis_plugin.description: A toolset that makes QGIS an interface for editing/viewing hydrogeological observational data (drillings, water levels, seismic data etc) stored in a sqlite db.
pyqgis_plugin.about: The plugin is a toolset for using QGIS to manage observational data from hydrogeological investigations. Data is stored in a spatialite database.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Intersect It
pyqgis_plugin.description: Intersect It is a QGIS plugin to construct points by intersection.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Intersect It is a QGIS plugin to construct points by with simple intersection from any layer of the map or by advanced intersection using 2 or more observations (distances and orientations). Advanced intersection is perfomed using a Least-Squares approach. Dimensions can also be saved from observations.

pyqgis_plugin.name: FlowMapper
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin generates flow lines between discreet nodes for visualising spatial interaction data (e.g. migration, trips).
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin generates flow lines between discrete nodes for depicting spatial interaction data (e.g. migration, traffic etc.). Plugin can generate Net/Gross/TwoWay flow lines based and also the flow nodes based on an interaction matrix and a pair of coordinates supplied in plain text (txt) format. All outputs are in shapefile format. Flow and node filtering capabilities are available as well as graduated symbology options. Test dataset and brief documentation is included.
pyqgis_plugin.tags: spatial interaction data,movement mapping,flow,flow mapping,od origin destination

pyqgis_plugin.name: Link It
pyqgis_plugin.description: Link It offers an easy way to link features on the map from the available relations in the project

pyqgis_plugin.name: SoilTexture
pyqgis_plugin.description: Build soil texture map from sand and clay raster maps
pyqgis_plugin.about: The plugin require two raster: spatial distribution for sand and clay for the same area. The user must supply even the texture schema and the name of output file. [http://maplab.alwaysdata.net/soilstools.html]

pyqgis_plugin.name: qNote
pyqgis_plugin.description: Save notes in QGIS projects

pyqgis_plugin.name: Quick Finder
pyqgis_plugin.description: Quick Finder offers a single place to perform searches on project layers and online remote services
pyqgis_plugin.about: The plugins allows to search by two different means. First, you can use online web services such as OSM or GeoMapFish. Second, you can define your own searches on local layers using expressions. These are stored on a local SQLite database which allow very fast searches.

pyqgis_plugin.name: ELECTRE-TRI
pyqgis_plugin.description: A decision aid plugin based on ELECTRE-TRI

pyqgis_plugin.name: mmqgis
pyqgis_plugin.description: A collection of QGIS vector layer operation plugins
pyqgis_plugin.about: MMQGIS is a set of Python plugins for manipulating vector map layers in Quantum GIS: CSV input/output/join, Geocoding, Geometry Conversion, Buffering, Hub Analysis, Simplification Column Modification, Color Ramps, and Simple Animation. MMQGIS provides an alternative to the native QGIS vector plugin set and Sextente, with verbose progress reporting, an intuitive user interface, direct shapefile/CSV-file access, and some additional capabilities missing from other plugin sets.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Statist
pyqgis_plugin.description: Calculate and show statistics for a field
pyqgis_plugin.about: Calculate and show statistics for a field

pyqgis_plugin.name: WFS 2.0 Client
pyqgis_plugin.description: Client for OGC Web Feature Service 2.0

pyqgis_plugin.name: GHydraulics
pyqgis_plugin.description: Hydraulic analysis of water supply networks (using EPANET)
pyqgis_plugin.about: GHydraulics allows to analyze water supply networks using EPANET. It allows to write EPANET INP files as well as running an EPANET simulation from QGIS complete with loading the result data. GHydraulics contains a function to calculate economic diameters based on given flowrates. The functions are accessible from the Quantum GIS plugin menu and toolbars.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Triangulation

Developed with funding from Regione Toscana-SITA.

pyqgis_plugin.about: Run a plugin and select an existing QML style file to apply it to multiple raster or vector layers to make them appear to be the same.

pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin allows you to create 1 layer for each unique value in a field/column.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Table Manager
pyqgis_plugin.description: Manages the attribute table structure
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin was created as a workaround for removing and renaming columns in dbf tables, when there was no built-in solution in QGIS. Currently, its development is depreciated, so please consider using the Refactor Field algorithm from the Pocessing panel (advanced interface).

pyqgis_plugin.name: Point sampling tool
pyqgis_plugin.description: Samples polygon attributes and raster values from multiple layers at specified sampling points
pyqgis_plugin.about: The Point Sampling Tool Plugin collects polygon attributes and raster values from multiple layers at specified sampling points. You need a point layer with locations of sampling points and at least one polygon or raster layer to probe values from. The plugin creates a new point layer with locations given by the sampling points and attributes taken from all the underlying polygons or/and raster cells. Please use Control and Shift keys in order to select multiple columns and bands. Note this tool is not compatible with mulitipoint sources, unless each multipoint contains exactly one point. Using multipoint samples that contain more points in multipoints may produce unreliable results.

pyqgis_plugin.name: FieldPyculator
pyqgis_plugin.description: Use python power for calculate fields of vector layers

pyqgis_plugin.name: OpenLayers Plugin
pyqgis_plugin.description: Google Maps, Bing Maps, OpenStreetMap layers and more

pyqgis_plugin.name: Tile Index Viewer
pyqgis_plugin.description: shows a preview of MapServer tile index rasters and allows to open raster layers

pyqgis_plugin.name: Numerical Vertex Edit
pyqgis_plugin.description: Allows to edit a vertex in a numeric way by clicking on it.

pyqgis_plugin.name: NumericalDigitize
pyqgis_plugin.description: Digitize with just the keyboard

pyqgis_plugin.name: Contour plugin
pyqgis_plugin.description: Generate contours of set of data points.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Generate contour lines (isolines) and/or filled contours of a field or expression on a point vector layer. Contours can be rendered with a ramp color. The contours are written to a memory (scratch) layer. If the MemoryLayerSaver plugin is installed these are saved with the QGIS project. Otherwise they can be saved to another persistant format. Requires python modules numpy, matplotlib, and shapely.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Synchronize QGIS with a directory
pyqgis_plugin.description: Lets you know when new layers are available in a directory, so that you can load them to QGIS
pyqgis_plugin.about: Lets you know when new layers are available in a directory, so that you can load them to QGIS. Think about a dropbox folder where you expect to get geospatial data; QGIS can inform you about new data ready to be loaded.

pyqgis_plugin.name: LecoS - Landscape Ecology Statistics
pyqgis_plugin.description: Contains several analytical functions for land cover analysis
pyqgis_plugin.about: LecoS is based on metrics taken from FRAGSTATS: http://www.umass.edu/landeco/research/fragstats/fragstats.html Functions include the calculation of metrics on rasters and vector layers. A polygon overlay tool is also available to ease up computation. Additionally LecoS provides some functionalities to manipulate classified raster images.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Crayfish
pyqgis_plugin.description: Visualiser for temporal structured/unstructured grids in QGIS
pyqgis_plugin.about: The Crayfish plugin aspires to be a time explorer for various grid and vector datasets within QGIS. With Crayfish, users can load time varying mesh into QGIS. Currently, Crayfish supports a number of hydraulic modelling software packages which output results to XMDF, SMS DAT, GRIB, HEC2D, netCDF, Serafin, FLO-2D and SWW. Examples of the software packages are: TUFLOW, AnuGA, BASEMENT, ISIS 2D, HEC-RAS 2D, TELEMAC, FLO-2D and Hydro_AS 2D. Crayfish loads and renders results directly rather than converting them to GIS formats before viewing. This allows users to flick quickly through the various output steps in the result files and to create animations.

pyqgis_plugin.name: PDOK services plugin
pyqgis_plugin.description: Plugin to easily load the available dutch PDOK (Publieke Dienstverlening Op de Kaart) services. Currently only in dutch.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Plugin to easily load the available dutch PDOK (Publieke Dienstverlening Op de Kaart) services. Currently only in dutch.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Cxf_in
pyqgis_plugin.description: Caricatore file CXF Catasto
pyqgis_plugin.about: GEOREFERENZIAZIONE FILE CATASTALI CXF DI TUTTA L'ITALIA La necessità di registrarsi per la georeferenziazione serve a garantire la qualità del dato e a non far proliferare sistemi di georeferenziazione che farebbero confusione. La procedura di georiferimento attuale è univoca (trasformazione di datum) e riguarda in maniera omogenea tutti i fogli dell'intero del Comune di riferimento. Per migliorare la georeferenziazione all'interno del singolo Comune deve essere applicata una trasformazione per singoli fogli. La procedure di georiferimento dei singoli fogli è presente per la Regione Friuli Venezia Giulia. Attendo progetti specifici per ampliare la gereferenziazione per singolo foglio per altre parti del territorio italiano. Cxf_in carica la trasformazione globale (trasformazione di datum) e se la trova successivamente applica i parametri di correzione al singolo foglio L'applicativo per la trasformazione è già pronto. Tale procedura necessita dei fogli catastali vettorilai. Per avere informazioni non esitate a scrivermi. Per informazioni scrivere a saccon@gisplan.it

pyqgis_plugin.name: MOLUSCE
pyqgis_plugin.description: Modules for Land Use Change Simulations
pyqgis_plugin.about: MOLUSE is designed to analyse, model and simulate land use changes. The plugin incorporates well-known algorithms, which can be used in land use/cover change analysis, urban analysis as well as forestry applications and projects.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Flow Trace
pyqgis_plugin.description: Select line segments upstream of a selected line segment
pyqgis_plugin.about: This Plugin will select all upstream polyline segments starting from a selected line segment. The only data you need to supply is a layer with polyline segments and a selected feature from the layer. If no segments are selected then you have connectivity issues with your data.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Layer to labeled layer
pyqgis_plugin.description: Make it possible to use data-defined labeling on existing layer. The plug-in creates new attributes for the label data in the existing vector layer.

pyqgis_plugin.name: ShellDB
pyqgis_plugin.description: Pass selected feature data to the shell
pyqgis_plugin.about: Pass selected feature data as arguments to a shell script, optionally remove features as they are processed by the script. Use this plugin when you must manually process lots of features on a map, for example proofing labels or finding elevation errors.

pyqgis_plugin.name: RT QSpider
pyqgis_plugin.description: Convert the selected table to an event layer (based on an X,Y pair) or to a spider diagram (based on two X,Y pairs)

pyqgis_plugin.name: Lifemapper Species Distribution Modeling, Macroecology and Phylogenetic Analyses
pyqgis_plugin.description: Lifemapper Species Distribution Modeling (LmSDM) and presence absence based Range and Diversity macroecology tools (LmRAD). LmRAD supports phylogenetic trees for linking statistics to Range/Diversity plots. (Release notes for version on github) Supported by US NSF Grants: BIO/DBI #0851290, EHR/DRL #0918590, BIO/DEB #1208472
pyqgis_plugin.about: Plugin for Lifemapper webservices for SDM modeling, and multispecies Presence Absence Matrix (PAM) analysis. The tool allows you to build SDM models using GBIF, iDigBio, or user supplied species occurrence data. A Lifemapper Archive Browser allows you to search the Lifemapper Archive for SDM projections and occurrence sets data through a hint service. You can use the browser by clicking the Lifemapper icon, you do not have to be logged in. Environmental layers can be uploaded and compiled into Environmental layer sets to model SDMs. PAM analysis can be driven by whole folders of species data organized by taxa, or phylogenetic trees. Trees can be supplied by the user, or browsed and used from Open Tree of Life. An extensive help system for each step in the workflow is supplied in each dialog.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Layer Combinations
pyqgis_plugin.description: Store and restore layer visibilities, foldings and zooms in "combinations". The visibilites can then be dynamically assigned to composer maps.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin is deprecated since functionality was added to core QGIS

pyqgis_plugin.name: DimLao
pyqgis_plugin.description: DimLao

pyqgis_plugin.description: Geospatial tool for managing point-based simulation models

pyqgis_plugin.name: Plain Geometry Editor
pyqgis_plugin.description: Edit geometry of features using plain text (WKT, WKB)

pyqgis_plugin.name: Points2One
pyqgis_plugin.description: Create lines and polygons from vertices.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Connects points in a layer to form lines and polygons.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Rectangles Ovals Digitizing
pyqgis_plugin.description: Helps to create Rectangles,Circles and ovals

pyqgis_plugin.name: Accuracy Assessment
pyqgis_plugin.description: Generate an error matrix and measures of mapping accuracy for raster and reference data.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin calculates an error matrix from two raster datasets and outputs a CSV file that can be loaded into a spreadsheet (LibreOffice Calc, or MicroSloth Excel). To use it, open your raster layers in QGis, launch the plugin, select the layer you want to use as the reference layer, select your comparison layer, and select an output file with a .csv extension. For more information, please see: https://github.com/jkibele/acc-assess
pyqgis_plugin.tags: confusion matrix,map comparison,error matrix,accuracy assessment,remote sensing

pyqgis_plugin.name: NetCDF Browser
pyqgis_plugin.description: allows to browse multi-variable and multi-dimensional netCDF files, requires GDAL >= 1.10

pyqgis_plugin.name: Semi-Automatic Classification Plugin
pyqgis_plugin.description: Plugin that allows for the supervised classification of remote sensing images, providing tools for the download, the preprocessing and postprocessing of images.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Developed by Luca Congedo, the Semi-Automatic Classification Plugin (SCP) allows for the supervised classification of remote sensing images, providing tools for the download, the preprocessing and postprocessing of images. Search and download is available for ASTER, Landsat and Sentinel-2 images. Several algorithms are available for the land cover classification. This plugin requires the installation of GDAL, OGR, Numpy, SciPy, and Matplotlib. For more information please visit https://fromgistors.blogspot.com/ . Keywords: Land Cover Supervised classification 土地被覆分類 监督分类 土地覆盖分类 教師付き分類 تصنيف استخدام الأراضي Classificação da Cobertura do Solo Clasificación de la Cobertura de la Tierra Classification de la Couverture du Sol классификация землепользования Klassifizierung der Landbedeckung Classificazione della Copertura del Suolo.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Tile Map Scale Plugin
pyqgis_plugin.description: Let you add tiled datasets (GDAL WMS) and shows them in the correct scale.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Tiled datasets like OSM are rendered for specific scales. If the scale is not the one the tiles are rendered for, the map is displayed unreadable. The plugin calculates the right scales and let you add GDAL WMS datasets.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Raster Interpolation
pyqgis_plugin.description: Raster Interpolation browses a vector layer of points, interpolates at their position the value of a raster layer and save the value in a chosen field of the vector layer. Interpolation can be nearest, linear or bi-cubic. Simple filter on the vector layer may be applied (browse only currently NULL values and/or only selected features).

pyqgis_plugin.name: Data-Driven Input Mask
pyqgis_plugin.description: Opens a data-driven input mask for any PostgreSQL Layer
pyqgis_plugin.about: DataDrivenInputMask is a QGIS plugin that automagically creates input masks for PostgreSQL layers. All table constraints (notNull, foreign keys etc.) are taken into account. From this mask the user can edit any data contained in related tables, too (n-2m relations). The appearance of the mask (field names, field order, tabs, min and max values) is configurable in dedicated database tables. In addition to the input mask a search mask is provided with exactly the same layout as the input mask.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Contrast homogenizer
pyqgis_plugin.description: Applies the contrast enhancement parameters of the selected layer to all visible layers
pyqgis_plugin.about: Contrast Homogenizer allows to apply the contrast stretching of the current layer to all visible layers in QGIS. Likely to be useful when you open several adjacent images as QGIS enhances the contrast of each image independently based on their histogram. So the rendering is not homogeneous. This plugin allows to have this homogeneity on display. Released by CS Information Systems. CS is designer and integrator of mission-critical applications and systems in the fields of defence, security, space, aeronautics, energy and industry. For more information, http://www.c-s.fr/.

pyqgis_plugin.name: New Memory Layer
pyqgis_plugin.description: Create an empty memory layer
pyqgis_plugin.about: The plugin creates a new layer in memory just in two simple clicks. All you need to do is to call the plugin, choose geometry type and optionally a name for the new layer. No attributes are created in order to make it as easy as possible. You can find the plugin button in the Layers toolbar as well as in the Layer->New Layer menu. You can also use a keyboard shortcut (Ctrl-M by default)

pyqgis_plugin.name: geoUmbriaSUIT
pyqgis_plugin.description: geographical MCDA for sustainability assessment
pyqgis_plugin.about: GeoUmbriaSUIT is a QGIS plugin for sustainability assessment in geographic environment, using environmental, economic and social criteria. The outputs of geoUmbriaSUIT are both geographic and graphic. More data and documents are available on http://maplab.alwaysdata.net/geoUmbriaSUIT.html
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: ARPA Umbria - University of Perugia (Developer: Gianluca Massei)

pyqgis_plugin.name: Multitemporal Analyzer
pyqgis_plugin.description: Multitemporal Analyzer of the surface area variation of a land cover. (University of Carabobo, Venezuela)
pyqgis_plugin.about: In this work, a software tool was developed in the form of a plug-in for Quantum GIS that allows for multi-temporal analysis with the purpose of detecting changes in land cover. The analysis is executed from multi-spectral images provided by the space program LANDSAT. This contribution allows the user community of GIS free software, the availability of an analysis tool, which optimizes the interpretation of natural resources so that they can propose policies and more efficient management plans.
pyqgis_plugin.tags: raster,raster image,universidad de carabobo,land cover,venezuela,remote sensing,analysis,multitemporal,multitemporal analyzer

pyqgis_plugin.name: LandXml import plugin
pyqgis_plugin.description: Import parcels and nodes from a LINZ LandXml file
pyqgis_plugin.about: The LandXml format is an Xml format used to transfer cadastral survey data. The format can describe cadastral survey parcels, nodes, and observations. This plugin is used to extract information from a LandXml data file into memory layers in the QGIS plugin. Currently it supports parcels and nodes, and observations. The plugin is designed to work with LandXml files generated by the Land Information New Zealand Landonline application - it may not support LandXml from other sources.

pyqgis_plugin.name: QChainage
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin takes line features and creates a new layer of points in provided distances on top of this Lines. Optionally you can set the startpoint (distance from the start of the line) and the endpoint (stop before reaching the end of the line) and automatically label the new points with the distances.
pyqgis_plugin.about: QChainage is either separating the selected (or all) Line-Features into parts, or linear referencing after a chosen distance. All along the whole Feature or between selectable start and endpoint.

pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin can render only tile maps in the tile format of Slippy Map (http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Slippy_Map) and similar web tile maps that y-axis of the tile matrix is inverted. Tile size should be 256 x 256.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Zoom to Point

pyqgis_plugin.name: geopunt4Qgis
pyqgis_plugin.description: NL: Plugin om geopunt diensten in QGIS te gebruiken: - Zoeken op adres [gewoon, in batch en prikken op kaart] op basis van CRAB (Vlaanderen) en URBIS (Brussel) - Zoeken naar Intressepunten in geopunt - zoeken naar wegenwerken en manifestaties in GIPOD - Hoogte Profielen tekenen - Zoeken naar percelen - Zoeken naar lagen in de geopunt catlogus EN: Plug-in to use geopunt services in QGIS: - Geocoding [regular, batch and reverse] based on CRAB (Flanders) and and URBIS (Brussels) - Search for POI's in geopunt - Search for trafic obstructions in GIPOD - Draw elevation profiles - Search for Parcels - Search for layers in the geopunt catalog
pyqgis_plugin.about:
geopunt4Qgis - "Geopunt voor QGIS" is een plugin voor de QGIS open source desktop GIS, die de webservices van het Vlaamse geoportaal Geopunt ontsluit naar desktop GIS-gebruikers.
Het Vlaamse Geoportaal Geopunt biedt een aantal geografische diensten (web-services) aan die mogen gebruikt worden door derden zoals andere overheden en bedrijven.
De kaartdiensten zijn gebaseerd op de OGC open standaard WMS of WMTS en kunnen gemakkelijk worden toegevoegd aan desktop GIS. GIS-gebruikers kunnen deze diensten ontdekken via het metadatacenter. De achterliggende zoekservice voor deze diensten is niet direct bruikbaar in QGIS en wordt in deze plugin ingebouwd.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Qgis2threejs
pyqgis_plugin.description: 3D visualization powered by WebGL technology and three.js JavaScript library
pyqgis_plugin.about: Qgis2threejs plugin exports terrain data, map canvas image and vector data to your web browser. You can view exported 3D objects on web browser which supports WebGL. This plugin uses three.js library.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Video UAV Tracker
pyqgis_plugin.description: Replay a video in sync with a gps track displayed on the map. Developed with SAL Engineering (http://www.salengineering.it/), in collaboration with INGV Bologna(Istituto Nazionale Geofisica e Vulcanologia) and University of Bologna sect. Geography (Readme.txt for more information)
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Salvatore Agosta - Università di Bologna - SAL Engineering

pyqgis_plugin.name: teamqgis
pyqgis_plugin.description: Supports digitizing training and validation data from remote sensing imagery. Based on the "itembrowser" plugin by Denis Rouzaud.
pyqgis_plugin.about:
teamqgis is a Quantum GIS (QGIS) plugin to support digitizing training and validation data for image classifications. The plugin was created to support the work of the Tropical Ecology Assessment and Monitoring (TEAM) Network. The TEAM Network is a global network of sites in tropical forests focused on collecting standardized real-time data measuring the response of tropical forests to changing climate, land cover and land use, and population.
teamqgis is based off of the itembrowser plugin created by Denis Rouzaud.

pyqgis_plugin.name: realcentroid
pyqgis_plugin.description: Creates internal points for a polygon layer
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin creates a point shape file with internal points of a polygon shape, similiar to the ST_PointOnSurface function of PostGIS. The point will be inside the polygon all cases. Not only the geometries are created but the attributes are also copied from the polygon to the internal point.

pyqgis_plugin.about: When you want to dig mechanically In the Netherlands you are obliged to request information on the area where you want to dig. The information on the network you receive can be viewed in QGIS. Information includes raster + letters + detaildrawings in pdf.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Viewshed Analysis
pyqgis_plugin.description: Advanced visibility analysis tool.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Viewshed analysis calculates visible surface from a given observer point over a digital elevation model. This plugin is native to QGIS and intended for more complex modelling, such as the depth below the visible horizon or generation of intervisibilty networks between groups of points. It is particularly performant for multiple viewshed calculations form a set of fixed points. For single point, large area viewsheds the algorithms already available in QGIS (GRASS r.los or SAGA viewshed module) would do the job.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Encoded Polyline Exporter
pyqgis_plugin.description: Export a vector layer to a .csv file in Encoded Polyline format, with optional geometry simplification
pyqgis_plugin.about: Read a comprehensive walkthrough on the plugin homepage.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Join multiple lines
pyqgis_plugin.description: Permanently join multiple lines
pyqgis_plugin.about:
After selecting multiple features of a line layer, this plugin can merge them into one feature with a continuous line.
The plugin will automatically put the selected lines in a geographically logical order and direction. If the end points of two lines do not match exactly, a line segment between both points is added to make the end result a single, continuous line. The attributes of the new line will be those of one of the selected features, but one cannot predict which one.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Transectizer
pyqgis_plugin.description: Transectizer is a QGIS plugin which provides an easy way to design linear transects with sampling stations distributed at a given distance along the transect.
pyqgis_plugin.about:
You can find Transectizer under Vector > Transectizer
Transectizer is a QGIS plugin which provides an easy way to design linear transects with sampling stations distributed at a given distance along the transect.
You can manually set the initial point and the bearing of the transect or you can interactivelly set it with the help of the mouse. Also, if you have a GPS connection enabled, you can get your coordinates from it.
Transectizer makes possible to automatically generate each individual station details (transect name, station name, station number) or have control over all the attributes of each station.
You can store your transects in a new layer or provide an existing layer for it. In that case, Transectizer will make the appropiate changes to your layer to make it compatible with Transectizer.

pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin is a retrieval tool for downloading National Topographic System data for Canada from the NRCAN FTP site (ftp://ftp2.cits.rncan.gc.ca/pub/). The user selects which data sets they are interested in (DEM, vector base layers, georeferenced Topo map), which scale they want to download the data (1:50000 or 1:250000) and the NTS mapsheet name(s) (e.g. 092H12, 092I etc...), and the tool just pulls the data from the ftp site (which is organized by Mapsheet names), unzips and organizes the data.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Attribute painter
pyqgis_plugin.description: Plugin for easy replication of attributes values between features
pyqgis_plugin.about: Attribute Painter usage: 1) Click on "Pick source feature" and select a sample feature on map. 2) On the table below will appears a selection list for attributes to be applied. 3) Check the attributes to be copied. 4) If necessary override source attributes values editing cells 5) If necessary remap destination field between those available in field combobox 6) Select destination features 7) Click on "Apply to selection" to apply attributes to selected features" or 6) Click on "Pick to Apply" to apply attributes to features one by one otherwise 8) Click "Reset source" to clear source selection Attributes settings are now persistent changing between layers

pyqgis_plugin.name: EasyCustomLabeling
pyqgis_plugin.description: Allows to quickly duplicate layer into memory layer ready for data defined labeling. Requires Memory layer Saver >= 3.2 to restore all labels correctly
pyqgis_plugin.about: EasyCustomLabeling is a plugin for QGIS, designed to simplify the work for manual and data defined labeling. The tool duplicates a data vector layer into a new memory layer made of lines, adds all necessary fields for advanced custom labeling like label location, rotation, color, font, callout, alignements. The resulting layer is activated ready to use labeling tools. Data is saved in Memory Layer provider, which means it is NOT saved to a file or a database. To make thoses layers persistent, please install Memory Layer Saver v3.2 or higher plugin, that saves all memory layers to a qdatastream file along the project named myqgisprojectname.qgs.mldata.
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Regis Haubourg (Agence de l'eau Adour Garonne)

pyqgis_plugin.name: TileCache Creator
pyqgis_plugin.description:
Project Retired. Use QTiles instead.
Create local disk tile cache for offline use of online sources in Spherical Mercator Projection (EPSG:3857).
pyqgis_plugin.about:
This plugin is a designed to work with the TileLayer Plugin and creates config files for the TileLayer Plugin when a tile cache is created.
Please note that this plugin does not check the legal status of downloading files from WMS sites, that is your responsibility!!
This plugin requires the python owslib.wms package. This is easily installed using pip or easy_install. Under Linux can be found in a variety of distribution packages such as python-setuptools or python-pip depending on your distribution.
Also note that projections other than EPSG:3857 are not supported and attempting to download them will generate an error.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Layer List
pyqgis_plugin.description: Manage common layers in lists, making it easier and quicker to add them to projects.
pyqgis_plugin.about: You can create a list from active layers, save the list, share it with others. You can also select a default list for your application that is always loaded when you start QGIS. The layer list is a *.qll file in text format, that you can edit and combine if you need to.

pyqgis_plugin.name: My Configs
pyqgis_plugin.description: Configure panel and tool bar visibility and placement sets for specific tasks
pyqgis_plugin.about: This lets you keep your user interface focused and clean which is especially useful for new GIS users who are often overwhelmed by rows and rows of buttons.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Station Lines
pyqgis_plugin.description: Create lines along polylines with some parameters (length, side, angle). It assumes a cartesian coordinate system

pyqgis_plugin.name: Click-Fu
pyqgis_plugin.description: Send click coordinates to various geoservices.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Originally written by Barry Rowlingson, ported to QGIS 2.0 by Maxim Dubinin (NextGIS).

pyqgis_plugin.name: Qgis Web Connector
pyqgis_plugin.description: The plugin is intended to act as web connector for Qgis. It allows to access http geo web services right from qgis binding to urls custom variables related to user input and map view. Tutorial on website.

pyqgis_plugin.name: postgisQueryBuilder
pyqgis_plugin.description: User friendly postgis query generation. Tutorial on website.
pyqgis_plugin.about: The postgisQueryBuilder QGis plugin is aimed to to provide a friendly environment to perform spatial analysis in postgresql/postgis without having to deal with SQL code. It is not intented to replace the Qgis built-in DBManager that has a wider usage covering all aspects of Qgis/Postgis interaction. It can be used in educational environments for a live analysis of the structure of the common spatial queries. The plugin can manage postgresql views and can be used for deploying spatial analysis frameworks based on chains of spatial relations.

pyqgis_plugin.name: IDECanarias
pyqgis_plugin.description: The plugin allows you to search all locations of Canary Islands
pyqgis_plugin.about: The plugin allows you to search all locations of Canary Islands, Spain

pyqgis_plugin.name: SimpliPy

pyqgis_plugin.name: SM

pyqgis_plugin.about: SM is a QGIS plugin that calculates and visualizes spatial indicators. These are indicators of changes of spatial patterns that govern the provision of ecosystem services in a catchment. The calculation requires the installation of PCRaster (Software for environmental modelling). The plugin also allows the visualization and animation of PCRaster mapstacks.

Polygon clipping from a selected polygon features clips all intersecting features and returns clipped…

pyqgis_plugin.name: Mapstack visualisation
pyqgis_plugin.description: PCRaster Mapstack visualisation
pyqgis_plugin.about: Mapstack_V is a QGIS plugin for PCRaster Mapstacks visualization and animation. PCRaster mapstacks are comprised of a series of map documents, each of which represents a single time-step.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Sync Composer With Map
pyqgis_plugin.description: Sync the map canvas extents with composer map
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin, when activated, will get the extents and scale of the current map canvas and synchronize those values with a map in the Composer. If you have multiple maps in Composer and would like to schronize a specific map, select the map in composer and activate plugin. The plugin is similar to the "Set to map canvas extent" button found in Item Properties in Composer but is easier to find for non-GIS proffessionals.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Constraint Checker
pyqgis_plugin.description: Generate reports of constraints (e.g. planning constraints) applicable to an area of interest.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Generate reports of constraints (e.g. planning constraints) applicable to an area of interest.
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Lutra Consulting for Dartmoor National Park Authority

pyqgis_plugin.name: PointConnector
pyqgis_plugin.description: Creating lines between points following a from-to list. The points can be read from a shape-file or a point-layer in the QGIS document. The list can be in a csv-file or a table in the document.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Maps Printer
pyqgis_plugin.description: Show, hide and export several print composers to pdf or image file (jpg, tif, png...) format in one click.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Exporting a print composer requires to open it, launch the export, wait till it finishes. This procedure can become boring, repulsive and time-consuming when you have to export a lot of print composers. Maps Printer offers a quick way to export print composers, without opening each one before : just check them in a list and launch their export to the file format you wish (pdf, jpg, tif, png...). Maps Printer also offers ability to open or close in one-click many print composers through right clicking.
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Harrissou Sant-anna (Conseil d'Architecture, d'Urbanisme et de l'Environnement du Maine-et-Loire)

pyqgis_plugin.name: QuickOSM

pyqgis_plugin.name: norGIS ALKIS-Einbindung

pyqgis_plugin.about: QGIS-Erweiterung zur ALKIS-Einbindung Funktion: * Einbinden von durch norGIS ALKIS-Import vorbereitete Datenbanken. * Einbinden in QGIS * Export von UMN-Mapfiles (optional, erfordert python-mapscript) * Signaturierung nach GeoInfoDok * Eigentümerabfrage (Einzelabfragen) * Client für norGIS Liegenschaftsbuch

pyqgis_plugin.about: Target audience is decision makers that work on suitability analysis for land use, agriculture, disaster management, environmental resources etc. The user-friendly interface makes analysis easier by dividing operations to different steps.

pyqgis_plugin.name: GeoAdmin Search
pyqgis_plugin.description: GeoAdmin Search Plugin
pyqgis_plugin.about: A plugin for geo.admin.ch web services

pyqgis_plugin.name: Dissolve with stats
pyqgis_plugin.description: Group geometries using one field, calculate stats on the other fields (mean, sum, count...)
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin is based upon the QGIS "dissolve" tool but adds the possibility to keep or not the other fields, and to calculate statistics on these other fields such as count, first and last for string fields, count, first, last, min, max, mean, median, standard deviation, and sum for numeric fields.

pyqgis_plugin.name: LOUIS Map Biographer
pyqgis_plugin.description: Effectively conduct direct to digital map biographies and traditional land use studies. Requires the pyaudio libary and oggenc. Also requires Processing, Red Layer and Multiline Join Plugins. Install the required libraries and plugins before installing Map Biographer.
pyqgis_plugin.about: The goal for LOUIS Map Biographer is to provide the quality and elegance of paper based interviews but deliver real time and cost savings by allowing effective and rapid direct-to-digital data capture by a single interviewer. This version is not compatible with releases before 1.0.8
pyqgis_plugin.tags: interviews,traditional land use,heritage,indigenous,local knowledge,traditional knowledge,use and occupancy mapping,aboriginal

pyqgis_plugin.name: OpenQuake Integrated Risk Modelling Toolkit
pyqgis_plugin.description: Tools for the development of composite indicators measuring societal characteristics and the integration of these with physical risk estimations
pyqgis_plugin.about: <p>Tools for creating and editing indicators and composite indices to measure social characteristics and for combining these with estimates of physical earthquake risk (i.e. estimates of human or infrastructure loss).</p><p>The plugin enables users to directly interact with the <ahref='https://platform.openquake.org'>OpenQuake Platform</a>, in order to browse and download socioeconomic data or existing projects, to edit projects locally in QGIS, then to upload and share them through the Platform.</p><p>This plugin was designed as a collaborative effort between the <a href='http://www.globalquakemodel.org'>GEM Foundation</a> and the <a href='http://www.cedim.de/english/'>Center for Disaster Management and Risk Reduction Technology</a>, and it has been developed by the GEM Foundation. It was formerly named GEM OpenQuake Social Vulnerability and Integrated Risk (SVIR)</p>

pyqgis_plugin.name: Genetic Line Simplifier
pyqgis_plugin.description: Line simplification tool using genetic algorithms
pyqgis_plugin.about: Plugin created as a alternative to the current simplifiers. As the genetic algorithm used is quite flexible it is possible to make it consider several restrictions to perform the simplification (e.g. topologic rules). This plugin is made to show the potential genetic algorithms have to solve GIS problems.

pyqgis_plugin.name: NNJoin
pyqgis_plugin.description: Nearest neighbour join. Join vector layers based on nearest neighbour relationships.
pyqgis_plugin.about: The NNPlugin joins two vector layers (the input and the join layer) based on nearest neighbour relationships. All geometry type combinations are supported. A feature from the input layer is joined to the nearest feature in the join layer. The result of the join is a new vector layer with the same geometry type and coordinate reference system as the input layer. Joining layers with different Coordinate Reference Systems (CRS) is supported, as long as the join layer coordinate system is a projected CRS. The join and distance calculations is performed using the join layer CRS. Self joins are supported. For self joins, each feature in the layer is joined to its nearest neighbour within the layer. A spatial index (QgsSpatialIndex) on the join layer is used to speed up the join for layers with non-multi-geometry types.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Swap Vector Direction

pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin allows to reverse the direction of a vector in a row or multi-row. Fr : Ce plugin permet d'inverser la direction d'un vecteur dans une couche ligne ou multiligne.

pyqgis_plugin.name: CartoDB

pyqgis_plugin.about: Features: - Manage CartoDB connections. - Add CartoDB layers to QGis projects. - Add features to CartoDB tables. - Edit data and update CartoDB tables. - Edit data and update geometries. - Delete features. - Upload tables - Create maps Dependencies: - CartoDB - oauth2 - simplejson - certifi

pyqgis_plugin.about: Azimuth and Distance Calculator Version 1.0.1 also generates: - Memorial descritivo - Memorial sintético - Selo da planta - Planilha de áreas e perímetros

pyqgis_plugin.name: Temporal/Spectral Profile Tool
pyqgis_plugin.description: Plots profile from raster bands. Based on Profile Tool.
pyqgis_plugin.about: A QGIS plugin for interactive plotting of temporal or spectral information stored in multi-band rasters. Based on Profile tool plugin. After installation and activation the plugin can be accessed either from main menu (under Plugins > Profile Tool > Temporal/Spectral Profile) or from an icon on the taskbar. This plugin is part of the Water Observation Information System (WOIS) developed under the TIGER-NET project funded by the European Space Agency as part of the long-term TIGER initiative aiming at promoting the use of Earth Observation (EO) for improved Integrated Water Resources Management (IWRM) in Africa. Copyright (C) 2014 TIGER-NET (www.tiger-net.org)

pyqgis_plugin.name: QgsWcsClient2
pyqgis_plugin.description: A OGC WCS 2.0/EO-WCS Client; a tool to download (and subset in space and time) a series of raster data
pyqgis_plugin.about:
The WCS 2.0/EO-WCS Client allows to specify an Area-Of-Interest and a Time-Of-Interest and then access/download the raster data (coverages) from OGC WCS-2.0 compliant servers. Unlike WMS, WCS enables the access to the original data (and not just to portrayals). The tool also handles the EO-WCS Application profile which allows to access/download a full time-series of coverages with just a few clicks. For multi-band EO-imagery the bands of interest can also be selected/sub-setted and their order in the output can be chosen. The downloaded coverages are directly loaded as layers into QGIS.
Requirements: This tool currently requires the python lxml-module to be pre-installed.
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Christian Schiller at EOX IT Services GmbH, Vienna, Austria

Currently supports selected algorithms from BEAM 5.0 (http://www.brockmann-consult.de/cms/web/beam/) and SNAP 2.0 (http://step.esa.int). The plugin requires BEAM and/or SNAP to be installed for it to be able to access their GPF algorithms. See README in code repository for further instructions. This plugin is part of the Water Observation Information System (WOIS) developed under the TIGER-NET project funded by the European Space Agency as part of the long-term TIGER initiative aiming at promoting the use of Earth Observation (EO) for improved Integrated Water Resources Management (IWRM) in Africa. Copyright (C) 2014 TIGER-NET (www.tiger-net.org)

Although originally designed for use in the the UK, enhancements have been made to improved utility in any geographical context.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Proportional circles
pyqgis_plugin.description: Proportional symbols are used for showing a quantity, for example the population of cities or countries. This plugin generates layers of proportional circles or sectors as a rose diagram and a legend. It is also possible to generate a legend without an analysis. Requires Memory layer Saver to save the memory layers.
pyqgis_plugin.about: The area of each circle or sector of the rose diagrams is proportional to a value in the attribute table of a points or polygons layer. The scale can either be fixed by the user or automatically calculated. In case of an automatic scale, the total of the areas of the circles equals 1/7 of the area of a reference polygons layer chosen by the user. The automatic legend of the circles contains three circles (corresponding to max value, max value / 3 and max value / 9), but it is also possible to use custom values.

The plugin allows one to | Connect to any iRODS (open source http://www.irods.org) datastore directly from QGIS | Import a spatial file from irods datastore to open map canvas on QGIS | Save a layer from the map canvas on QGIS to your iRODS datastore as a spatial files

pyqgis_plugin.name: spatialJoin
pyqgis_plugin.description: The plugin is aimed to perform spatial joins dynamically, without creating a new table, using expression fields and refFunctions plugin (needed as dependency). All the standard topological condition are available (intersection, within, touches ....))
pyqgis_plugin.about: The new plugin called "SpatialJoin" is aimed to perform spatial joins without creating a new table, using the full set of available tolological condition. This is done exploiting the new expression fields feature, available from release 2.6. The plugin, using the "refFunction" expressions extension, needed as dependency, creates a expression spatial key field ("spjoin_rif") based on reference functions and joins the desidered fields with a value by id function in expression fields as well. The result is a complete dynamic table that resolvs spatial joins on the fly, evaluating the current layers features. All the plugin newly added fields are signed with a "spjoin_" suffix

pyqgis_plugin.name: navidata.pl geocoder
pyqgis_plugin.description: Plugin implements geocoding service for Poland using navidata.pl API
pyqgis_plugin.about:
Navidata is a polish company providing geocoding services based on OpenStreetMap data - this QGIS plugin allows to quickly geocode large amount of addresses using navidata.pl API.
Please note that this plugin works only for addresses in Poland!

pyqgis_plugin.name: strictVoronoi
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin generates a Voronoi diagram, some parts of it those are possible to be changed by points position out of the reserved polygon are removed.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Circumscribed circles for each triangles of TIN are used to judge. If a part of a circumscribed circle is out of the reserved polygon, the shape of the triangle is possible to be changed by point positions which are out of the polygon, so the Voronoi area of all points which belong to such triangles are removed. Attention that the point and polygon layer must be saved as the same CRS, and the CRS must be same as that of project. Additionally, identifier index should be specified at the first of parameter set (The most left side corresponds to 0). Of course, each attribute of the identifier should be unique.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Survey design plugin

pyqgis_plugin.about: A plugin to design biomass surveys along coast lines. The survey design dialog can be opened under Survey -> Survey design. Developed for NIWA, New Zealand
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: National Institute of Water and Atmospheric Research (NIWA)

pyqgis_plugin.name: SCP-Plugin
pyqgis_plugin.description: Plugin for Structured Conservation Planning of Marine Protected Areas

pyqgis_plugin.name: Multi-distance buffer
pyqgis_plugin.description: Create multiple distance buffers
pyqgis_plugin.about: The Multi-Distance Buffer plugin creates a multi-distance buffer vector dataset from an input vector layer and a set of distances. The result dataset consists of bands (donut type) of regions according to the buffer distances provided. If 100 and 200 are provided as distances, the result dataset will consist of two bands - one will contain all areas that are within 100 units from the geometries of the input vector layer, the other will contain all areas that are from 100 to 200 units from the geometries of the input vector layer. The user can choose to only buffer around selected features.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Oceancolor Data Downloader

The plugin is experimental and in the future it will benefit from a number of improvements that will be made in the QGIS Processing toolbox.

This procedure is very useful, for example, for making relief and hypsometric class maps.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Indicatrix mapper
pyqgis_plugin.description: The plugin projects the tiss-circles from a reference sphere to a selected projection. By the usage of On The Fly (OTF) transformation method we can study the distortions of the circles in a blink.
pyqgis_plugin.about: The plugin introduces the tiss-indicatrix (quick-and-dirty Tissot-indicatrix realization) term by Szabó and Wirth. The tiss-indicatrix uses circles of constant radius (tisses) instead of the original infinitesimal circles. QGIS contains approximately 2700 categorized projections. With the latitude and longitude parameters you can define the resolution of tisses and the graticule. The graticule and tiss segments means the preciseness of the circle and the axes (parallels, meridians). By increasing their segment-value they are getting more precise, exact. The radius parameter means the magnitude of projecting tiss circles. In case of adding more layers untick the Simplify geometry at Rendering. ---------- Authors: Ervin Wirth: Budapest University of Technology and Economics, Department of Photogrammetry and Geoinformatics, PhD student Péter Kun: NNG Ltd. Technical writer

pyqgis_plugin.name: DSG Tools
pyqgis_plugin.description: Brazilian Army Cartographic Production Tools
pyqgis_plugin.about: DSGTools with the following features: -Creation, Storage and Deletion of PostGIS servers configurations -Database creation using Spatialite and PostGIS according to EDGV version 2.1.3 and EDGV version FTer_2a_Ed (cadaster) -Layer loading by category and class as defined by EDGV version 2.1.3 and EDGV version FTer_2a_Ed (cadaster) -Manipulation of complex features (Creation, Editing, Deletion, Zoom, Association, Disassociation) and -Access to some WM(T)S services provided by BDGEx. -Inventory Tool for all geospatial data supported by GDAL/OGR. -Tool to install Models and Script (geoalgorithms) in the Processing Toolbox (HSV fusion script available). -Database role management. Access profile (i.e. Read/Write permissions by table in database ). -Database user profile management (e.g. Grant/Revoke predifined roles to/from user ). -Create/Remove PostgreSQL users. -Alter PostgreSQL user Password. -Conversion tools between postgis and spatialite EDGV databases. -Tool to assign elevation values to contour lines in a simple way. -EDGV code list viewer to aid attributes queries using our EDGV databases. -Drop EDGV databases -Remove missing databases from qsettings Requirements for LINUX (Ubuntu/Debian): Install the following packages as follows: sudo apt-get install python-qt4-sql sudo apt-get install libqt4-sql-psql sudo apt-get install libqt4-sql-sqlite

pyqgis_plugin.name: gridSplitter
pyqgis_plugin.description: A plugin that cuts a layer into pieces(tiles)
pyqgis_plugin.about: The plugin takes input files (vector or raster) and cuts these into a fixed amount of parts or into fixed-size parts, storing them on the harddisk. There is an option to cut the tiles by predefined shapes (cutlayer). It is not thought for data preparation on pseudo-mercator tiling services, as gdal2tiles already does this job (naming, crs and file storage conventions differ). It is just for "cutting the map into handy bits and leave the map data untouched". The plugin uses GDAL/OGR if found.

On a Debian-like distributions this is as easy as running "pip install 'ipython[all]==3.1.0 qtconsole' or (better) "pip install jupyter==1.0.0 qtconsole". pyqgis_plugin.name: Thin greyscale image to skeleton
pyqgis_plugin.description: Thin a greyscale image to a skeleton
pyqgis_plugin.about: The Thin Greyscale plugin will thin a greyscale image to a greyscale skeleton image, given a set of levels. For multiband images, the band to be thinned can be specified. Integer and decimal bands are supported.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Magnetic Declination
pyqgis_plugin.description: Calculates the magnetic heading from a true geographic heading and vice versa.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Uses the NOAA National Geophysical Data Center, epoch 2015 data. The World Magnetic Model (WMM) are accurate to within 30 minutes of arc for D and I and about 200 nanoTesla for the intensity elements.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Elevation Viewer
pyqgis_plugin.description: Allows easy extrapolation from a vector elevation layer to determine the elevation between two points
pyqgis_plugin.about: Allows easy extrapolation from a vector elevation layer to determine the elevation between two points. The user is prompted to select two points between which elevation will be measured. This information, along with the layer on which the vector-elevation data resides, the attribute that represents the elevation, and selection of a suitable projection allows the elevation to be determined. The result is a 2D "side view" with a line representing line-of-sight between the two points, overlaid on a "terrain" view.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Red Layer
pyqgis_plugin.description: quick georeferenced sketches and annotations
pyqgis_plugin.about: A qgis plugin for sketching and drawing on map canvas. It is intended for quick annotations and field use. Sketches can be drawn in different colors and widths and can be converted in memory layer if needed. The sketches are stored in the project directory in a separate .sketch txt file that can be shared with other users.

pyqgis_plugin.name: LCCS3 Basic Coder
pyqgis_plugin.description: The plugin loads a LCCS3 legend, creates a form with all LCCS3 classes and allows the user to code selected features
pyqgis_plugin.about:
LCCS3 Basic Coder is devoted to make easy the coding of geographical features on the basis of the classes of a LCCS3 legend. The main features are: - selection and loading of a LCCS3 legend - display of the list of LCCS3 classes - selection (and activation) of the vector layer containing the features to be coded - selection of the column (in the attributes table) to archive the LCCS3 codes - coding selected features
LCCS3 is the last version of the Land Cover Classification System (LCCS) developed by FAO and UNEP in 1998 to facilitate the understanding of the classes of land cover regardless of the scale of mapping, the type of coverage, method of data collection, or geographic location.
LCCS3 is an implementation of Land Cover Meta Language (LCML), become a standard ISO in 2012 with the identification 19144-2:2012. The LCML provides a common reference structure for the comparison and integration of data for any generic land cover classification system, and describes different land cover classification systems based on the physiognomic aspects.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Validation Tool
pyqgis_plugin.description: Validation Tool for ESRI Shapefile based on scientific paper named "Making better use of accuracy data in land change studies: Estimating accuracy and area quantifying uncertainty using stratified estimation"
pyqgis_plugin.about:
This tool was developed by René Kopeinig MSc. (UNDP) with support of Julian Equihua and Dr. Steffen Gebhardt (Conabio). This plugin was developed in order to have the possibility to validate the in Conabio derived MAD-Mex landcover classification and change products with the algorithm of P.Olofsson.
Note: I really want to know about your experience with the vTool, please feel free and mail me on renekope@gmail.com about it. I do appreciate your contribution.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Layer Board

pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin helps to see and modify properties for vector and raster layers. It shows the layers in a table sheet, and the user can directly modify some properties such as layer name, title, abstract, minimum and maximum scales. Some actions can be performed on multiple layers at once, such as modifying spatial reference system and scale based visibility. The layers information can be exported to Comma Separated Values (CSV).

pyqgis_plugin.name: Spreadsheet Layers
pyqgis_plugin.description: Load layers from spreadsheet files (*.ods, *.xls, *.xlsx)
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin adds a "Add spreadsheet layer" entry in "Layer" / "Add new Layer" menu and a corresponding button in the "Layers" toolbar. These two links open the same dialog to load a layer from a spreadsheet file (*.ods, *.xls, *.xlsx) with some options (use header at first line, ignore some rows and optionally load geometry from x and y fields). When this dialog is accepted, it creates a new GDAL VRT file in same folder as the source data file, expanded with a .vrt suffix which is loaded into QGIS using OGR VRT driver. When reusing the same file twice, the dialog loads its values from the existing .vrt file. No need to install additional dependencies.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Customize ToolBars

pyqgis_plugin.name: Grid Zone Generator

pyqgis_plugin.name: QGISConefor
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin integrates the Conefor landscape conectivity analysis software with QGIS.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Conefor is a software that provides tools for studying landscape conectivity. It features a command line version that is available for Windows, Mac OS and Linux. It can be downloaded from http://conefor.org This plugin integrates Conefor with QGIS. It can be used in two modes: * A plugin dialog with a custom GUI that can be used to generate the input files needed in order to run Conefor analysis. These files can then be used to run Conefor externally and perform the study. * A set of Processing algorithms that can be used to work with Conefor inside QGIS. It provides algorithms for both preparing Conefor inputs (the same functionality as available in the plugin's dialog) and also for running most of Conefor's algorithms. This makes it possible to create Processing models and scripts that efectively enable a user to use QGIS as a frontend to interact with Conefor. * Conefor authors are Santiago Saura (santiago.saura@upm.es) and Josep Torné. This plugin was developed by Ricardo Garcia Silva (ricardo.garcia.silva@gmail.com) with funding from ETSI Montes, Universidad Politécnica de Madrid. The plugin is released under a GPL license.

pyqgis_plugin.description: QGIS plugin to add geospatial data from mongodb database.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin allows you to add collection from mongodb as layer in QGIS. It requires pymongo>=3.0 python plugin for mongodb access ($pip install pymongo). Layer from mongodb collection is created in memory and named after collection (with some random numbers). As for now save to database is not supported. Please report bugs and suggestions on github issues tracker. To use it just click connect button. Choose database and collection. Finally Mark if geometry is like in geojson or pick proper field with geometry. If geojson-style than all the geometry types are supported otherwise points / lines geometries only. Other data in collection are added as feature attributes. Data in "properties" field can be used as data if key was found. See examples for details.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Space Syntax Toolkit
pyqgis_plugin.description: Collection of tools for spatial network analysis and data exploration.
pyqgis_plugin.about: The “Space Syntax Toolkit” is a QGIS plug-in for spatial network and statistical analysis. It provides a front-end for the depthmapX software within QGIS, offering user friendly space syntax analysis workflows in a GIS environment. It is primarily aimed at supporting the standard space syntax methodology, and enhancing its workflows with standard GIS data, analysis and visualisation features. However, the added functionality can be of general benefit to QGIS users by introducing new tools for exploratory spatial data analysis. The plug-in was originally developed at the Space Syntax Laboratory, The Bartlett, UCL. Mailing list: spacesyntax-toolkit@jiscmail.ac.uk Dependencies: For network analysis requires depthmapXnet. It can be downloaded from: http://archtech.gr/varoudis/depthmapX/?dir=depthmapXnet
pyqgis_plugin.tags: numeric attribute visualisation,space syntax,network analysis,spatial analysis

Uses the method described in Hergarten et.al. (2014) "Extracting topographic swath profiles across curved geomorphic features".

pyqgis_plugin.name: Multi Ring Buffer
pyqgis_plugin.description: Create multiple fixed distance buffer rings around a feature/set of features. Works on selected layer. Select layer and click on the Multi Ring Buffer icon. Creates "doughnut" ring buffers, not including the buffered feature.
pyqgis_plugin.about:
Create multiple buffer rings around a features/set of features. Works on selected layer. Select layer and click on the Multi Ring Buffer icon. Creates "doughnut" ring buffers, not including the buffered feature.
Works by default in a sequential manner by buffering the resulting buffer and differencing the previous buffer. Also by default the buffer dissolves the features before buffering. Dissolving makes adjacent features behave in a better manner without overlapping buffers. The QGIS buffer feature has the logic behind this.
Thanks to Neil Benny and Matt Walsh.
FAQ: https://rawgit.com/HeikkiVesanto/QGIS_Multi_Ring_Buffer/master/help/index.html

pyqgis_plugin.name: Load MongoDB Layers
pyqgis_plugin.description: Load Points, Linestrings, Polygons and MultiPolygons from MongoDB
pyqgis_plugin.about: Dependencies: pymongo, json, ast The Load MongoDB Layer plugin allows you to quickly and easily load Point, Linestring, Polygon and MultiPolygon geometry and their attributes into a shapefile. Unlike Mongoconnecter, no additional configuration is required and Polygon geometry is loadable. To load the layer simply type the your MongoDB server name, db name, geometry field name and click CONNECT. Example: my.server.com.au geos geom
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Adrian Aksan (Special thanks to Guillame de Boyer)

pyqgis_plugin.name: PolygonComplexity
pyqgis_plugin.description: Calculating the complexity of polygons
pyqgis_plugin.about: Plugin for QGIS 2.0 that calculates the complexity of polygon features. The complexity measure provides a quantitative description of the polygon shape. It can be used as an input for other geometric algorithms, or to find out if any algorithm depends on the geometric complexity of input polygons in terms of speed or quality of outputs. The index of complexity used in this plugin is taken from the paper by Brinkhoff, Kriegel, Schneider, and Braun. The advantage of their approach is that it considers local variations of the polygon border. The plugin also calculates a simple compactness measure that relates the area of the polygon to the length of its border.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Diff

pyqgis_plugin.name: maps2WinBUGS
pyqgis_plugin.description: a tool to facilitate data processing for Bayesian spatial modeling
pyqgis_plugin.about: Bayesian methods for spatial modeling and analysis are being increasingly used in different research fields (e.g. ecology, epidemiology, social science). In Bayesian spatial modeling, perhaps the most widely used tool is GeoBUGS, which is included in WinBUGS and OpenBUGS. These applications are very flexible and user-friendly for modeling in a Bayesian framework. In spatial statistics, a primary source of data is the map to which attribute data may be linked. In GeoBUGS, vector digital maps are used. In most cases, these types of maps are developed in a geographic information system (GIS). The different GISs use map protocols for handling vector (or pixel) graphical maps. These map formats are convertible with each other. GeoBUGS cannot read the formats that most GISs support, but can read special formats (ArcInfo, S-Plus, and EpiMap) to describe the spatial structure of vector graphical maps. The user must convert any vector digital map to one of these formats before using GeoBUGS. This conversion can be done many ways, and may be facilitated by specialized tools. The aim of the development of maps2WinBUGS was to produce an open source, free, and relatively easy-to-use tool with functions for the preparation of maps and tabular data for spatial modeling with GeoBUGS.

pyqgis_plugin.name: GiSedTrend
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin allows to perform a Grain Size Trend Analysis
pyqgis_plugin.about: GiSedTrend is a QGIS plugin allowing to perform a Grain Size Trend Analysis (GSTA). To perform the analysis, the user can provide either a text file (.txt or .csv) or an ESRI shapefile (.shp) including the three needed statistical parameters, i.e. mean, sorting and skewness. Results can be save both in text file format or in ESRI shapefile format.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Natural Earth Raster
