pyqgis_plugin.about: Create your own menus with your favorite layers. Easy configuration is done with drag & drop from the qgis browser.

pyqgis_plugin.name: RasterStats
pyqgis_plugin.description: Raster Statistics toolbox for QGIS
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin is designed to return basic raster statistics regarding raster files for polygons in a given layer. It is MANDATORY that the vector layer has a field named ID with unique numbers for result reporting. In addition to the tools that already exist in QGIS for computing raster statistics, this plugin allows for the computation of histograms for zones and provides a wider range of summary statistics (Average,Mean,Median,Standard deviation,Variance,Minimum and Maximum)

pyqgis_plugin.name: QBAN(O)
pyqgis_plugin.description: QBAN(O) permet de géolocaliser vos adresses issues d'un fichier excel ou CSV. Il se sert de la base BAN (Base Adresse Nationale).
pyqgis_plugin.about: Le fichier des adresses doit être ouvert dans Qgis. L'adresse doit être contenue dans une seule colonne (numero, rue, code postal, ville). Une fois la géolocalisation effectuée, une colonne "score" permet de connaitre la fiabilité de l'adresse, 1 étant la meilleure note (à partir de 0,5, la localisation est fiable).

pyqgis_plugin.name: QPackage
pyqgis_plugin.description: Qpackage is a tool to archive your GIS data contained in your projects QGIS towards a new directory.
pyqgis_plugin.about: It allows to convert any GIS format towards the SHP only. He can also apply a new projection. Finally, he can process the data by batch processing.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Select Within
pyqgis_plugin.description: Centroid within and point of surface within selection. Useful mainly for within selections between two polygon layers. Should work with points, lines, and polygons.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Centroid within and point of surface within selector.

pyqgis_plugin.name: GMSH
pyqgis_plugin.description: This is a plugin to interract with the GMSH mesh generator (see http://geuz.org/gmsh).
pyqgis_plugin.about: Generate geometry input files for the GMSH mesh generator (http://geuz.org/gmsh) and convert the GMSH mesh file to shapefiles that can be imported into QGIS. The nightly snaphshot(http://geuz.org/gmsh/#Download) version of GMSH is required to mesh the generated .geo files. For more details, see this tutorial : https://github.com/ccorail/qgis-gmsh/wiki.

pyqgis_plugin.name: DEMto3D
pyqgis_plugin.description: 3D Printing of terrain models.
pyqgis_plugin.about: DEMto3D is the first tool that links GIS (Geographic Information System) and 3D printing. DEMto3D allows export DEM to STL format ready to 3D printing.

pyqgis_plugin.name: RASOR FloodMap
pyqgis_plugin.description: Plugin developed for the FP7 RASOR Project (http://www.rasor-project.eu/). Able to generate RASOR compliant floodMaps for SENTINEL-1 images. Depends on the SENTINEL-1 (ESA) toolbox and Orfeo-Toolbox (CNES). They are pre-requisites of the plugin and must be installed.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Plugin developed by Altamira-Information.

pyqgis_plugin.name: INSPIRE Nederland plugin voor QGIS
pyqgis_plugin.description: A tool to query INSPIRE datasets of the Dutch national dataportal "National Georegistry (NGR)" and add it to QGIS. - Een tool om de INSPIRE datasets uit het Nationaal Georegister te bevragen en toe te voegen aan QGIS.
pyqgis_plugin.about: In Nederland zijn inmiddels zijn meer dan 350 datasets en bijbehorende services geregistreerd in het Nationaal Georegister (http://www.nationaalgeoregister.nl/) als INSPIRE dataset of service. Om het gebruik te vergemakkelijken voor de professionele GIS-gebruikers in Nederland worden voor de twee meest gebruikte GIS software pakketten – te weten QGIS en ArcGIS Desktop – plugins ontwikkeld. Deze plugins maken het gemakkelijk om direct via het Nationaal Georegister de INSPIRE datasets en services te vinden, te raadplegen en te downloaden. Deze plugin is de QGIS-versie.

pyqgis_plugin.name: REC2
pyqgis_plugin.description: NIWA REC2 plugin
pyqgis_plugin.about: The REC2 plugin allows the user to perform upstream and downstream queries of NIWA REC River Network layers.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Worldwide night
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin computes worldwide night geometry for a given date.
pyqgis_plugin.about:
This plugin computes worldwide night geometry for a given date. The output is exported to a SHP file (Coordinate Reference system = EPSG:4326). Requirements: Matplotlib Basemap Toolkit Python library (>= 1.0.7). https://github.com/matplotlib/basemap
Author: Cayetano Benavent, GIS Analyst at Geographica http://www.geographica.gs
cayetano.benavent@geographica.gs

pyqgis_plugin.name: PosiView
pyqgis_plugin.description: PosiView tracks multiple mobile objects and vehicles and displays their position on the canvas
pyqgis_plugin.about: Track multiple objects and vehicles and display them as shapes and points on the canvas

pyqgis_plugin.name: changeDataSource
pyqgis_plugin.description: Right click on layer tree to change single layer datasource of click on icon to change datasources globally
pyqgis_plugin.about: The plugin allows to change the datasources of the loaded layers. The operation can be performed right clicking on legend items for single layer or globally on a summary table by clicking on toolbar plugin icon. The plugin takes control of bad layers handling allowing to specify valid datasources working on project

pyqgis_plugin.name: Dynamic Layers
pyqgis_plugin.description: Change the datasource of chosen layers dynamically by searching and replacing user defined variables.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin helps to change the datasources of many layers at once, for example to create different versions of the same project on different extents. You can use some variables such as {$myvar} inside the layer datasource, and then define theses variables (from a table or from an input vector source). Finally you apply the variables values on every configured layer via the apply button, and you can see the changes before saving the project. Documentation : https://github.com/3liz/QgisDynamicLayersPlugin/blob/master/README.md

pyqgis_plugin.name: Spatial Subset Query tool
pyqgis_plugin.description: EN: Make a spatial query on postgis database that selects a subset from a dataset based on the intersection with a geometry from an other preselected dataset in the same database. NL: Maak ruimtelijke query die een subset van een dataset op selecteert op basis van de intersectie met een gepreselecteerde laag overeenkomstig bij een bepaalde waarde.
pyqgis_plugin.about: A tool developed for the Flemish Environment Agency (Vlaamse Milieu Maatschappij VMM). The Database needs be configured before it can be used. Dit is een tool ontwikkelt voor Vlaamse Milieu Maatschappij (VMM). De databank instellingen moeten worden geconfigureerd voordat hij gebruik kan worden.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Geosearch DK
pyqgis_plugin.description: Search and zoom to named places in Denmark
pyqgis_plugin.about: Uses Kortforsyningen services for searching addresses, road names, place names, land registry and a lot more. Developed by Septima.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Online Routing Mapper
pyqgis_plugin.description: Generate routes by using online services (Google Directions, Here, MapBox, YourNavigation, OSRM etc.)
pyqgis_plugin.about: You dont need data anymore to calculate routes for your maps. Just point the start and stop locations. It will generate routes by using online services.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Discovery
pyqgis_plugin.description: Provides search / gazetteer functionality in QGIS using PostGIS-based data
pyqgis_plugin.about: The Discovery plugin adds search capability to QGIS. Its key features are: - Connects directly to PostgreSQL / PostGIS (no reliance on web services) - Auto-completion of results - Flexible expression-based support for scales - Can use multiple fields to display result context - Simple GUI-based configuration

pyqgis_plugin.name: Backup layer
pyqgis_plugin.description: Backup the selected layer by saving the corresponding data file(s) in a zip file with datetime stamp appended to name
pyqgis_plugin.about: Backup layer creates a compressed archive (zip) of the data files corresponding to the selected layer. The plugin will search for all files with the same name (and same path) as your data file, independently of the file extension. The compressed archive will be saved in the same folder as the original data file with current datetime stamp appended to the file name. By using this plugin you can easily, from within qgis, create a backup copy of your layer before you start editing. This plugin will only work with layers where the data source is a file and not where the data source is a database (no matter if it is a single file database).

pyqgis_plugin.name: Physiocap
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin helps analysing raw data from Physiocap inside Qgis. This is a plugin dedicaded to Physiocap users "Agronomist of the vine". This version is available in French and English. Cette extension aide à l'analyse des données brutes de Physiocap sans quitter Qgis. Il est dédié aux utilisateurs de Physiocap "Agronome de la vigne"
pyqgis_plugin.about: Physiocap est un capteur qui géolocalise des mesures de diamètre des sarments d'une vigne. L'extension (plugin) Physiocap n'intéresse que le métier "Agronomie de la vigne". Le capteur est embarqué sur un portique qui porte deux cellules qui traitent un rayon laser et réalise une mesure du diamètre des sarments. Il s'agit de mesures directes de la fréquence et du diamètre des sarments: indicateurs fidèles de l'expression végétative et de la vigueur de la vigne. L'extension permet de faire l'analyse des données brutes sans quitter Qgis. Les paramètres précisent les seuils de filtre de données. Les résultats de chaque itération de calcul sont présentés sous forme de shapefiles thématisées. Une synthèse et des histogrammes permettent de valider le traitement des données brutes. A partir de votre contour de parcelles de vigne, des moyennes inter parcellaire sont calculées et présentées. Ces extractions de moyennes et de points à la parcelle permettent de réaliser une interprétation agronomique des résultats. Nous conseillons l'appui d'un agronome ou d'un technicien vigne averti. Physiocap est breveté par le CIVC.

pyqgis_plugin.name: First Aid
pyqgis_plugin.description: The must-have tool for Python plugin developers
pyqgis_plugin.about: Provides Python debugger and replaces the default Python error handling in QGIS with a more sophisticated handler that allows more thorough inspection or the Python error: browse the frames, view variables, see source code or even execute Python code within the context of the error.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Form Value Relation
pyqgis_plugin.description: Form (Aware) Value Relation Widget: an enhanced Value Relation widget and a custom function to read all the form values and build dynamic filters for your drill-down forms.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This is a core-enhancement plugin that allow the implementation of complex dynamic filters in QGIS attribute forms. This plugin provides a "Form Value Relation" widget (very similar clone of QgsValueRelationWidgetWrapper) that refreshes the related item values on every change in the form values and that makes available the form values to the context. The expression is re-evaluated every time the form changes if the changed fields are part of the expression. A custom expression function "CurrentFormValue()" allow to read the form values from the expression context. This widget can be used to implement drill-down forms, where the values available in one field depend on the values of other fields. This plugin has been funded at 50% by "ARPA Piemonte"

pyqgis_plugin.name: cReports
pyqgis_plugin.description: Creates customized reports from selected object in QGIS
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin allows you to generate customized reports from selected object in QGIS

pyqgis_plugin.name: Interactive Map Tracking
pyqgis_plugin.description: A QGIS 2.6 plugin to track camera of user , AND/OR to autocommit/refresh edit on PostGIS vector layer
pyqgis_plugin.about:
# About # This plugin has 2 components that can be activated/desactivated configured trough the GUI. Detailed user doc : https://github.com/Remi-C/interactive_map_tracking/wiki
#Features #
* First feature is to __track camera position__ of the user. - Each time the user move the camera, it is _saved_ in a vector layer along with user_id and current time. If a user is editing something, it allows him to know _where_ the edit was already done.
- If the vector layer is a PostGIS layer, _multiple users_ can simultaneously edit the layer, so that each user knows where the other user are editing, and have been editing.
* The second feature only acts on __PostGIS vector layer__. - When a selected PostGIS vector layer is edited, the edition is __immediatly saved__ and send to the database, and the screen is __refreshed__. - This allows to work with PostGIS layers that use __triggers to recompute geometry__ on the fly.
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Lionel Atty, IGN, SIDT || Remi Cura, IGN THALES

pyqgis_plugin.name: Layer Metadata Search
pyqgis_plugin.description: Search for PostGIS tables using metadata
pyqgis_plugin.about: Layer Metadata Search is a plugin used to search GIS metadata. Layer Metadata Search can be used to search data describing the "who, what, where, when and how" of map layers. Layer Metadata Search was developed on behalf of Dartmoor National Park, UK.
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Lutra Consulting for Dartmoor National Park Authority

pyqgis_plugin.name: RiverGIS
pyqgis_plugin.description: RiverGIS is a QGIS plugin that helps you create HEC-RAS flow model.
pyqgis_plugin.about: The functionality is similar to that of HEC-GeoRAS. For data store and spatial operations it needs a PostGIS database.

pyqgis_plugin.name: QMetaTiles
pyqgis_plugin.description: Generate tiles(using metatiling) from QGIS project. Also provides a QGIS export for the LatLonGO mobile solution. Based on the QTiles plugin.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Generate tiles(using metatiling) from QGIS project. Also provides a QGIS export for the LatLonGO mobile solution. Based on the QTiles plugin.

pyqgis_plugin.name: mongo_memorizer
pyqgis_plugin.description: create memory layer from geojsons stored in mongo
pyqgis_plugin.about: Create memory layer from collection in mongo database, is able to get subset of data using mongo query. Objects in collection should have the same geometry type. All nodes in properties are handled. Nested properties are handled as geojson.

pyqgis_plugin.name: GeoServer Explorer
pyqgis_plugin.description: Configure and manage GeoServer from QGIS
pyqgis_plugin.about: Easily configure GeoServer through QGIS. Prepare data and styling or publish directly to a catalog directly from the QGIS interface, or add a service from GeoServer into your QGIS project. The plugin integrates with the Processing framework, so this tasks can beautomated or used as part of a workflow.

pyqgis_plugin.name: PostTelemac
pyqgis_plugin.description: Post Treatment for Telemac ( and Anuga - experimental)
pyqgis_plugin.about: Post treatment of open Telemac results (and Anuga as experimental). Requires matplotlib, shapely, numpy, scipy and networkx libraries.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Ellipse
pyqgis_plugin.description: Create ellipses based on minor and major axis diameter widths and a rotation angle
pyqgis_plugin.about: Create ellipses/ovals in QGIS (can be used for example to map wind turbine separation distances). Enter minor ellipse axis diameter, major ellipse axis diameter and rotation angle (in degrees) parameters, which will draw the ellipse in the centre of your current map window, to then be moved as you wish.
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Script: Pete Wells (Lutra Consulting); Plugin: Ali Moyle (Ecotricity)

pyqgis_plugin.name: OSMInfo
pyqgis_plugin.description: Get full information about a point from OpenStreetMap database.
pyqgis_plugin.about: For a selected point, extract all information abour nearby and enclosing features from OpenStreetMap database using Overpass API.

pyqgis_plugin.name: CMaps Region Generator
pyqgis_plugin.description: Automate merging features using a CSV file definition.
pyqgis_plugin.about: CMaps Analytics Region Creator is a utility designed for typical business intelligence practitioners or dashboard developers to transform typical geographic administrative areas like zip, state, and country into custom business regions and territories.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Floodrisk
pyqgis_plugin.description: Floodrisk is an Open Source software to combine the main features of state-of-the-art science, collaboration, transparency and interoperability in an initiative to assist authorities for flood risk analysis and management
pyqgis_plugin.about: Developed by RSE & University of Basilicata

pyqgis_plugin.name: Minkowski dimension calculator
pyqgis_plugin.description: Minkowski fractal dimension calculation for vector layer features
pyqgis_plugin.about: Plugin calculates Minkowski fractal dimension (also known as Minkowski–Bouligand dimension; box-counting dimension) for features of vector layer.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Serval
pyqgis_plugin.description: Map tool to set raster cell values.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Usage: The tool has 3 modes: probing, drawing and erasing. In the probing mode cell values are read and can be changed manually in a spinbox. In drawing mode, chosen pixel band values are written to disk. Erasing is assigning NoData value. For 3 bands rasters, native QGIS color picker can be used to define bands values.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Spatial Design Network Analysis
pyqgis_plugin.description: Allows use of the sDNA toolbox from QGIS
pyqgis_plugin.about: Allows use of the sDNA toolbox from QGIS. sDNA version 3.1 or above must be installed first from http://www.cardiff.ac.uk/sdna sDNA is a spatial network analysis tool with general applicability, but particularly suited to modelling urban networks. Standard sDNA currently calculates various measures of network density, gravity models, floating catchment, closeness, betweenness, convex hull and severance statistics. These can be based on different analysis metrics (Angular, Euclidean, Custom). Additional tools allow network preparation, statistical learning and prediction based on sDNA models. Analyses can be weighted or unweighted, and weights can be applied per polyline, link or unit length. An advanced version called sDNA+ is also available which can use arbitrary metrics from a user formula (hybrid metrics) as well as having presets for pedestrian, cyclist and vehicle use, and the ability to output analysis geometries (network radii, geodesics, convex hulls; one-to-one, one-to-many, one-to-all or all-to-all). Version 3.1 adds OD Matrix input and Skim Matrix output. Development of this plugin was funded by the ESRC Impact Accelerator grant "sDNA for all". The principal investigator was Alain Chiaradia and the co-investigator Crispin Cooper, based at Cardiff University department of Geography and Planning and the Sustainable Places Research Institute.

pyqgis_plugin.name: MergeLines
pyqgis_plugin.description: Simplifies the topology of a line network by merging adjacent lines
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin merges segments of a line network (e.g. river network) in order to simplify its topology. Two merging methods are currently available : length (a segment is merged with its longest neighbor) and alignment (a segment is merged with its best aligned neighbor).

pyqgis_plugin.name: QOSM
pyqgis_plugin.description: Open Street Map tiles in QGIS
pyqgis_plugin.about: Download and use Open Street Map <http://www.openstreetmap.org/> and other tiled basemap sources. Similar to the OpenLayers plugin and TMS layers, except QOSM has smarter cacheing, works better in non-cylindrical projections, and offers options to cache tiles and manipulate zoom levels. The Quick Map Services Plugin is also worth trying if extended or extensive cacheing is not needed.

pyqgis_plugin.name: CKAN-Browser
pyqgis_plugin.description: Download and display Open Data from CKAN Metadata Servers
pyqgis_plugin.about: Download and display Open Data from CKAN Metadata Servers

pyqgis_plugin.name: ShpSync
pyqgis_plugin.description: description
pyqgis_plugin.about: Links an Excel (.xls) file to a Shapefile (or any other layer). For every row on the layer a row in the Excel file is created. Derived information like area or centroid can be added to the Excel row.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Historical Map
pyqgis_plugin.description: Automatic vectorization of old forests from historical maps
pyqgis_plugin.about: Made by Nicolas Karasiak & Antoine Lomellini<br>Based on the work of Pierre-Alexis with the help of Mathieu Fauvel.<br><br>This plugin allow the user to filter an image (tif) with closing filter and median filter (you can set the parameters), then you can train with a shapefile of your perimeter, and to finish you get a shapefile with your selected class (ie: a shapefile of the forest from historical map, or of the vineyards...)<br><br><b>We suggest you to install SciKit-Learn before installing the plugin (or you will be forced to use GMM classifier and not KNN,RF or SVM).<br>For more information you can consult our tutorial at the <a href="https://github.com/lennepkade/Historical-Map/">Historical Map plugin page</a>.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Pandora
pyqgis_plugin.description: Integrated model for the for mathematical analysis of landscape evolution and equilibrium scenarios assessment.
pyqgis_plugin.about: PANDORA was proposed to assess the effects of different planning strategies on final possible equilibrium states that are energetically stable. It provides a tool for the evaluation of landscape functionality and its resilience.
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Raffaele Pelorosso and Federica Gobattoni, Universita' della Tuscia, Viterbo - Dipartimento di scienze e tecnologie per l'Agricoltura, le Foreste, la Natura e l'Energia (DAFNE). Developer: Francesco Geri - Sistema Lab snc.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Strahler
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin computes the Strahler number of a line network.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin adds a user-specified attribute to the shapefile containing the analyzed line network. This attribute will contain the Strahler number (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strahler_number) of each segment (=line) of the network. User must first select the root of the network.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Selection Sets
pyqgis_plugin.description: Plugin for saving and loading selection sets for layers.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Adds the ability to save and load sets of selections. Handy if you need need to come back to a active selection layer.

pyqgis_plugin.name: ImportEpanetInpFiles
pyqgis_plugin.description: Import Epanet Input Files
pyqgis_plugin.about: ImportEpanetInpFiles converts EPANET Input File to shapefiles and adds them in the QGIS canvas. Also, the shapefiles stored into the _shapefiles_ folder.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Socrata
pyqgis_plugin.description: Download maps from Socrata-powered data portals
pyqgis_plugin.about:
This is a simple plugin built to facilitate GIS sharing from Socrata sites. It is added to the web menu, as it is pulling from web datasets. This is not a Socrata product.
How to use:
In the web menu, select Socrata > Socrata Plugin
In the Settings tab, write in the domain of the Socrata Open Data portal (the url without 'https://') for example 'data.nola.gov'
In the Download tab - select "Get Maps" A dialog box with a list of all available maps will be presented. Select one and click Ok.
The unique id will populate in the box below. If you wanted to see the map online simply navigate to https:// {domain} /d/ {unique id}
Press Ok and the map will be added to your current view. You can repeat this process as many times as you like.

pyqgis_plugin.name: GeODinQGIS
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin connects GeODin with QGIS
pyqgis_plugin.about: GeODin is an industry standard software for the collection, interpretation and presentation of geo-information. GeODinQGIS is an additional tool for the work with GeODin. It connects GeODin databases with QGIS. Currently supported actions are: creation of new GeODin objects, display GeODin data in QGIS, execute SQL queries, view GeODin layouts.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Geometry Updater
pyqgis_plugin.description: Updates a vector layer's features geometry from another vector layer by using ID
pyqgis_plugin.about: When you want to uptade/change a layer's features' geometry from another layer this is the plugin that you need. It uses an identifier column (ID, PKUID, etc.) for matching features and updates target layer from reference layer.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Instagram2qgis
pyqgis_plugin.description: Search and downloading Instagram images.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Search and downloading Instagram images and create a point shapefile with them.You need install some additional Python libraries:instagram,httplib2,requests,simplejson,six

pyqgis_plugin.name: TUFLOW
pyqgis_plugin.description: A collection of utilities for TUFLOW modelling in QGIS
pyqgis_plugin.about: A collection of utilities for TUFLOW modelling in QGIS. Includes visualisation of results / inputs Editing tools Styling tools

pyqgis_plugin.name: Disconnected Islands
pyqgis_plugin.description: Finds disconnected "islands" in a transport network layer, so that a routing tool will work between all nodes. A tolerance field allows for imperfect topology.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Feature Loader
pyqgis_plugin.description: A loader tool for inserting new features to target vector layer
pyqgis_plugin.about: You can easily load features from one layer to another one. This plugin exactly designed for updating database layers such as Oracle Spatial, Postgis, MS SQL Spatial. But you can also use it for file based formats. Note that the layer you will update have to be editable.

pyqgis_plugin.name: ECO Pluvia Downloader
pyqgis_plugin.description: Esta ferramenta facilita a aquisição de dados de precipitação disponíveis no Portal HidroWeb.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Esta ferramenta foi desenvolvida pelo Grupo de Pesquisa em Modelagem Hidroambiental e Ecotecnologias da Universidade Federal de Santa Maria, visando facilitar a aquisição de dados de precipitação utilizados para estudos hidrólogicos e disponibilizados pela Agência Nacional de Águas no Portal HidroWeb.
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Jessica Fontoura, Daniel Allasia, Robson Pachaly, Vitor Geller, Rutineia Tassi, Gabriel Froemming, Jean Favaretto

pyqgis_plugin.name: QAD
pyqgis_plugin.description: Quantum Aided Design: cad like commands in QGIS
pyqgis_plugin.about: Quantum Aided Design: cad like commands in QGIS

pyqgis_plugin.name: Zoom to Postcode in Czech Republic
pyqgis_plugin.description: Zoom the map extent to postcode in the Czech Republic
pyqgis_plugin.about: Zoom the map extent to postcode in the Czech Republic. Location of codes is based on RUIAN data.
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Jan Ruzicka, Martin Konecny, Roman Siwek, Jana Kahankova, Lubos Csonka

pyqgis_plugin.name: Speedy Layer
pyqgis_plugin.description: Generate memory layer from vector layer. Speed up for analysis and rendering operations.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin transforms a vector layer to memory layer with two clicks. Also you can select which attribute fields will be included.

pyqgis_plugin.name: DIVI QGIS Plugin
pyqgis_plugin.description: QGIS integration with DIVI system by GIS Support sp. z o.o. / Integracja QGIS z platformą DIVI firmy GIS Support sp. z o. o.
pyqgis_plugin.about: DIVI QGIS Plugin is extension for QGIS written in Python. It allows to view and edit data from DIVI system (http://divi.pl) created by GIS Support sp. z o. o. Plugin was created by GIS Support sp. z o. o. (http://www.gis-support.com) FEATURES: - Show assigned accounts, projects, layers and tables in list. - Load DIVI layers and tables to QGIS. - Load DIVI layers only of specified geometry type. - Load all layers from DIVI project. - Edit spatial data using standard QGIS tools: add/remove features, edit geometries and attributes, add/remove fields. - Edit DIVI layers/tables names. - Upload layers from QGIS directly to DIVI. ---- DIVI QGIS Plugin jest wtyczką do aplikacji QGIS, która służy do zarządzania danymi w systemie DIVI (http://divi.pl) firmy GIS Support sp. z o. o. Pozwala ona na przeglądać i edytować dane przestrzenne bezpośrednio w QGIS. Wtyczka została stworzona przez GIS Support sp. z o. o. (http://www.gis-support.pl) MOŻLIWOŚCI: - Wyświetlanie dostępnych kont, projektów oraz warstw i tabel w formie listy. - Dodawanie warstw i tabel DIVI do QGIS, każdy typ geometrii warstw (punkt, linia, poligon) wczytywany jest jako osobna warstwa. - Wymuszenie załadowania warstwy DIVI dla danego typu geometrii. - Wczytanie wszystkich warstw z danego projektu. - Edycja danych przestrzennych: dodawanie/usuwanie obiektów, edycja geometrii i atrybutów, dodawanie/usuwanie pól w tabeli atrybutów. Edycja odbywa się standardowymi narzędziami GIS. - Zmiana nazwy warstwy/tabeli DIVI. - Tworzenie nowych warstw DIVI poprzez przesłanie warstw QGIS. - Odświeżenie wczytanych danych poprzez ponowne ich pobranie z systemu DIVI.
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Piotr Pociask, GIS Support sp. z o. o.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Attribute based clustering
pyqgis_plugin.description: Attribute based clustering for vector layers by numeric attributes using hierarchical (native) or k-means (scipy needed) algorithms.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Plugin produces clustering for features of vector layer based on unlimited number of attributes using hierarchical or k-means algorithms. Hierarchical algorithm is native, k-means requieres scipy. You can define weight for every attribute, if hierarchical clustering used.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Sort and Number
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin sorts and numbers an attribute table.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin adds a new field to an attribute table, where features are numbered depending on multiple sorting criteria.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Projection Factors
pyqgis_plugin.description: Visualise scales, distortions and meridian-parallel angle in map projections.
pyqgis_plugin.about:
Main purpose of this plugin is to visualize distortions, scales or angles in the active area, i.e. over the area where data is present. This can help one to decide whether special consideration of distortions is necessary for calculations or analysis performed with GIS operations.
Factors are calculated as raster map for project CRS which should not be geographic or geocentric.
Area for which factors are to be calculated is defined in geographic coordinates.
Some projections can't map whole spheroid. Start with smaller regions and expand as necessary.
Do not use to big raster if it is not necessary (it will take long to generate and resource problems may occur). Size of between 200 and 1000 px should be enough for most purposes.
Use inverted pseudocolor spectral palette on min-max values range with raster contour extraction operation to generate labelled isolines for even better understanding of distribution and values of distortions and scales.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Report Plugin
pyqgis_plugin.description: Plugin for fast reporting of issues to the tracker
pyqgis_plugin.about: Plugin for fast reporting of issues to the tracker.

pyqgis_plugin.name: dzetsaka : Classification tool
pyqgis_plugin.description: Fast and Easy Classification plugin for Qgis
pyqgis_plugin.about: Plugin for semi-automatic classification with Gaussian Mixture Model classifier. Very easy and fast.<br>You need to have scipy and scitkit-learn libraries.<br>For more information on this tool you can go on your homepage <a href="https://github.com/lennepkade/dzetsaka/">Dzetsaka Classification Tool on Github</a>

pyqgis_plugin.name: Magnifying Glass
pyqgis_plugin.description: Maps with a Magnifying Glass Tool "Concept" for Qgis.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Tool for observing different base maps with a magnifying glass.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Standard Deviational Ellipse
pyqgis_plugin.description: Create a standard deviational ellipse for a set of points
pyqgis_plugin.about: A standard deviational ellipse is produced according to the method presented by Robert Yuill (1971). The method does not correct for degrees of freedom. The method does not give a radius equal to the standard distance deviation for a random point distribution (to achieve this, the SDs should be multiplied by sqrt(2), as explained in the CrimeStat documentation). The plugin also offers the CrimeStat / aspace method, where there are corrections for degrees of freedom and with sqrt(2). A polygon vector layer with the standard deviational ellipse is produced, containing the attributes: meanx, meany, majorangle, minorangle, majorsd and minorsd. Angles are counter-clockwise relative to the first axis. An attribute for weighting can be selected. There are no external library dependencies.

pyqgis_plugin.name: VetEpiGIStool
pyqgis_plugin.description: Spatial functions for veterinary epidemiology
pyqgis_plugin.about:
VetEpiGIStool is a free QGIS tool that helps veterinarian users in the management of spatial data related to animal disease. This plug-in combined the huge amount of GIS functions offered by QGIS with a simple user interface that allows to the user the possibility to manage data without the necessity to define the data model, the data organization model, and the data presentation, because these issues are pre-organised in the “piece” of software specifically developed.
Developers: Norbert Solymosi from University of Veterinary Medicine, Budapest.
Contributors: Nicola Ferrè; Matteo Mazzucato; Paolo Mulatti; from Istituto Zooprofilattico Sperimentale delle Venezie (http://www.izsvenezie.it).

pyqgis_plugin.name: NextGIS Connect
pyqgis_plugin.description: Create, connect and use your own fully-functional Web GIS at nextgis.com.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Welcome to brand new cloud Web GIS from NextGIS! With this plugin you can upload/download geodata to and from your Web GIS, manage layers and much more. We'd love to hear feedback about your experience at http://nextgis.com/contact.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Cartographic Line Generalization
pyqgis_plugin.description: Generalize lines suitable for presentation on printed or screen maps.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Algorithm gives lines (contours, coastlines, rivers etc.) on map with good geometrical and visual properties suitable for presentation on paper or screen maps. Level of generalization is controlled only by map scale making it very simple to use. If the result still looks too detailed or too coarse for some purpose, just change the scale parameter. It has distinct property of area preservation of features. This ensures that polygons do not collapse to lines or points, and also ensures closeness of input and generalized line. Nevertheless, topological issues are possible, e.g. self-intersections or intersections of features. The generalization combines simplification followed by smoothing. Generalization algorithms are based on area preserving approach known from generalization theory. This simulates manual generalization, and parameters of the algorithms were defined by analyzing manually generalized lines in different scales.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Quick STEP
pyqgis_plugin.description: Accuracy assessment of object-based image classification - GEOBIA
pyqgis_plugin.about: Quick STEP plugin for QGIS implements STEP, a novel object-based similarity matrix, for assessing both geometric and thematic accuracies of remote-sensing image classification. In contrast to the traditional error matrix, STEP uses samples of classified and reference objects rather than counts of pixels. Moreover, STEP provides four (4) similarity metrics for characterization of classified objects compared with reference objects: (i) shape similarity (S); (ii) theme similarity (T); (iii) edge similarity (E); and (iv) position similarity (P). For more information see: <a href = 'http://www.tandfonline.com/doi/abs/10.1080/01431161.2014.943328'>Lizarazo, I. (2014). Accuracy assessment of object-based image classification: another STEP. International Journal of Remote Sensing, 35(16), 6135-6156.</a><br><br>If you feel like Quick STEP plugin for QGIS has made a contribution to your research, please consider citing it using: Ramirez, S., & Lizarazo, I.(2016). Quick STEP: Accuracy assessment similarity matrix for GEOBIA. QGIS plugin version 0.1. <br><br>An example dataset for this plugin is located here: <a = href="https://goo.gl/Gso2B3">https://goo.gl/Gso2B3</a>
pyqgis_plugin.tags: geobia,edge similarity,position similarity,similarity matrix,accuracy assessment,theme similarity

pyqgis_plugin.name: CAIGOS PostGIS Konnektor
pyqgis_plugin.description: Connector/Provider for CAIGOS-GIS PostGIS projects
pyqgis_plugin.about: Remark: CAIGOS-GIS is a German-speaking product. Thatswhy the plugin is only available in German language. . Ab CAIGOS Version 2016 (ab 11.2 optional) werden die Projektdaten in einer SQL-Datenbank gespeichert. Bevorzugte Umgebung ist dabei PostgreSQL mit PostGIS. Damit bietet sich die technische Möglichkeit die Geodaten ohne Konvertierung direkt in QGIS einzubinden. Der Schwerpunkt liegt dabei auf der Präsentation der Daten. Der große Vorteil der direkten Einbindung ist dabei die (fast) komplette Übernahme der Darstellung der einzelnen Ebenen. Dabei werden sowohl Punktsymbole, Ebenenprioritäten, Individualattribute als auch maßstabsabhängige Darstellungen übernommen. Selbstverständlich ist auch eine Übernahme von Fachschalendaten bzw. GISDB Tabellen möglich. Für die Darstellung in QGIS wird Projektstruktur mit Fachschalen/Themen/Gruppen und Ebenen 1:1 übernommen. . Bedienung: Nach Einbinden des PlugIns sind die Funktionen unter dem Menüpunkt "Datenbank" --> "CAIGOS-Datenprovider" verfügbar.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Freehand raster georeferencer
pyqgis_plugin.description: Interactive georeferencing of rasters
pyqgis_plugin.about: Tools to georeference a raster interactively (move, rotate, scale, export…)

pyqgis_plugin.name: InADS GeoCoder
pyqgis_plugin.description: Geocoder plugin for Estonian InADS geocoding service
pyqgis_plugin.about: Geocoder plugin for Estonian InADS geocoding service

pyqgis_plugin.name: Lat Lon Tools
pyqgis_plugin.description: Tools to capture and zoom to coordinates using standard decimal or DMS (latitude,longitude) notation.
pyqgis_plugin.about: When working with Google Earth, Google Maps or other on-line mapping tools, coordinates are specified in the order of 'Latitude, Longitude'. Lat Lon Tools uses the standard Google Map format or a format as specified in "Settings". The plugin has three tools. The first captures coordinates to the clipboard when the user clicks on the map. The second takes decimal, DMS, or MGRS formatted coordinates, zooms to the point and highlights the location. The 3rd creates a list of points for rapid zooming. Lat Lon Tools makes it possibly to seamlessly copy and paste between QGIS, Google Earth, and other on-line maps. All tools work with latitude and longitude coordinates regardless of the QGIS project coordinate reference system. In Settings the user can choose the delimiter used between coordinates. The user can choose whether the capture format is in decimal degrees, DMS coordinates, native CRS, or MGRS coordinates. The user can also specify the coordinate order of 'Longitude, Latitude' in Settings.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Kortforsyningen
pyqgis_plugin.description: Easy acccess to Services from Kortforsyningen (Danish Map supply) in QGIS Desktop.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin makes it easy to use the services from Danish Map supply aka Kortforsyningen. A new menu is added to QGIS which contains services ordered by category. The plugin is developed by Danish Map supply (Agency for Data Supply and Efficiency). In order to use the plugin, a user at Kortforsyningen.dk is required. Enter your username and password in the plugin setting dialogue. If you do not have a Kortforsyning user please create one using the link in the plugin setting dialogue. The plugin is developed by the Agency for Data Supply and Efficiency (fka Danish Geodata Agency)(www.kortforsyningen.dk, kortforsyningen@gmail.com)
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Danish Agency for Data supply and Efficiency
pyqgis_plugin.tags: wms,inspire,sdfe,styrelsen for dataforsyning og effektivisering,denmark,kortforsyningen,danish map supply,dansk,danmark,agency for data supply and efficiency,open data,danish

pyqgis_plugin.name: Groundwater Vulnerability
pyqgis_plugin.description: Groundwater Vulnerability Mapping (GLA method)
pyqgis_plugin.about: The concept of groundwater vulnerability describes the vulnerability of an aquifer to contamination. Several point count system models exist to calculate this vulnerability, for example DRASTIC, GLA, EPIK, GOD and PI. Version 1.0 of this plugin includes the german GLA method. It uses maps of available water capacity, annual percolation rate and aquifer covering lithology to calculate the protective function of an aquifer.

pyqgis_plugin.name: QEsg
pyqgis_plugin.description: Sanitary Sewage System Networks Design
pyqgis_plugin.about: Sanitary Sewage System Networks Design Used Libraries: -Qt matplotlib -ezdxf (Embedded) from Manfred Moitzi

pyqgis_plugin.name: QGIS GML Application Schema Toolbox
pyqgis_plugin.description: Prototype to load OGC Complex Features in QGIS
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugins allows to import Complex Features streams in QGIS either through a native XML mode or through a conversion to a relational database model

pyqgis_plugin.name: Another DXF Importer / DXF2Shape Converter
pyqgis_plugin.description: Add DXF to QGIS and convert DXF to Shape
pyqgis_plugin.about: Features: - Other elements than the standard import are displayed - Display of text (Labeling) - Categorization by Layer - Group by Layer - Separate representation by layers possible

pyqgis_plugin.name: LM Open Data WMTS
pyqgis_plugin.description: Swedish National Land Survey Open WMTS layers
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin makes it easy to add <b>Swedish National Land Survey</b> WMTS layers to your QGIS project. You will need a National Land Survey <i>"token"</i> key which you can get at <a href="https://opendata.lantmateriet.se/#register">https://opendata.lantmateriet.se/#register</a>.<br><br>Map layers are Open Source Licensed with <i>CC BY Lantmäteriet</i> (<a href="http://www.lantmateriet.se/sv/Kartor-och-geografisk-information/Kartor/oppna-data/villkor/">License</a>).<br><br>The National Land Survey do <u>not</u> support this plugin!

pyqgis_plugin.name: Mahalanobis Distance
pyqgis_plugin.description: Calculates Mahalanobis distance
pyqgis_plugin.about: Calculates distance that indicates which regions in a landscape are most similar to some ideal landscape

pyqgis_plugin.name: Isogeo
pyqgis_plugin.description: Isogeo search engine within QGIS
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin helps finding geodata, searching within Isogeo catalogs. To use it, an Isogeo account is required, you can ask a free one sending a mail to projects+qgis@isogeo.com.

pyqgis_plugin.name: J.Assy - Mapa de Plantio
pyqgis_plugin.description: Generation of map of planting using Visum data. Geração de mapa de plantio utilizando dados do Visum
pyqgis_plugin.about: Plugin developed by J. Assy intending to ease the generation of maps of planting based on data collected from Visum. Plugin desenvolvido pela J. Assy com o objetivo de automatizar tarefas no QGIS e proporcionar que diversos mapas de plantio auxiliares sejam gerados, utilizando os dados colhidos pela central Visum.

pyqgis_plugin.name: VERSAO VegaMonitor
pyqgis_plugin.description: Pre-processing, Phenology detection, Vegetative drought indices
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin was develloped in the framework of VERSAO project (Vers une Estimation spatialisées des Rendements par télédétection pour la Sécurité alimentaire en Afrique de l’Ouest) funded by CNES. It allows to preprocess data, extract phenological metrics and calculate various indicators describing the evolution of vegetation and climate conditions.

pyqgis_plugin.name: D3 Data Visualization
pyqgis_plugin.description: D3 Date and Time Heatmap
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin creates a D3 circular histogram heatmap from date and time fields in the data. It outputs an interactive web page.

pyqgis_plugin.name: QGIS Resource Sharing
pyqgis_plugin.description: Download collections shared by other users
pyqgis_plugin.about: Developed initially as GSoC 2016 project, this plugin allows users to search for available collections and install them. Users can also create repositories to put the collections there. There are some options where to put the repository: Github, Bitbucket, local file system, or with https(s). Please read the documentation for more information.

pyqgis_plugin.name: AutoFields
pyqgis_plugin.description: Automatic attribute updates when creating or modifying vector features
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin allows you to configure vector fields to be automatically calculated for you when digitizing new features or modifying existing ones. Think about it as triggers in a database or as an automatic Field Calculator.

pyqgis_plugin.name: SEC4QGIS
pyqgis_plugin.description: Funciones relativas a la Sede Electrónica del Catastro (SEC) para QGIS.<br/><br/>Functions related to Spanish Cadastral Electronic Site (SEC) for QGIS.
pyqgis_plugin.about: El complemento SEC4QGIS (SEC para QGIS) es una herramienta gratuita basada en software libre que permite importar a QGIS la cartografía descargada de la Sede Electrónica del Catastro (SEC) de España en múltiples formatos (FXCC de planta general, FXCC de parcela más colindantes, DXF de zona, y GML de parcela), para editarla de una forma gráfica conforme al trabajo de campo realizado por un técnico (o un particular), y exportar dicha cartografía editada a formato GML INSPIRE de parcela catastral para obtener su Informe de Validación Gráfica Alternativa (IVGA) en la SEC. Por favor, consulte la ayuda y la página web del complemento para obtener más información.

pyqgis_plugin.name: QNetwork
pyqgis_plugin.description: Manage and analyse networks via GDAL
pyqgis_plugin.about: Manage and analyse networks of different geospatial formats using GNM (Geographical Network Model) which is a part of GDAL library. Currently only ESRI Shapefile format is supported for building networks. You can create connectivity over a set of Shapefiles and after that do Dijkstra shortest path search, K-shortest paths search or Connected components search. Also you are able to block features and see the changes in results of such analysis. Important: the plugin requires that QGIS is built with GDAL 2.1 (or later) in which GNM is turned on.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Rocky Branches - RoadNetwork
pyqgis_plugin.description: Easy-to-use area of availability calculation for road distance
pyqgis_plugin.about: An easy-to-use tool for rendering road network analysis data, including: - Dijkstra paths (from source node) - Demographics-based cost-benefit analysis

pyqgis_plugin.name: POI Exporter
pyqgis_plugin.description: Export Garmin CSV or GPX Points of Interest (POI)
pyqgis_plugin.about:
This plugin creates Points of Interest (POI) from a vector points layer. It supports Garmin CSV and GPX output formats. The GPX format can be imported into Garmin's BaseCamp. The plugin allows the user to select a category column to be used to create separate files containing points from that category. The user can also select columns to be used for the POI name and description. The plugin is installed at "Vector->GPS->POI Exporter"
This was developed for Garmin GPS devices but will probably work with other GPS devices. Let me know if there is another GPS non-proprietary data format that should be supported. I will try my best to try and accommodate it.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Roadnet
pyqgis_plugin.description: Local Street Gazetteer Database Management Tool
pyqgis_plugin.about: roadNet is an application for managing a BS7666-compliant local street gazetteer (LSG). It was created by thinkWhere to address the needs of local authorities in Scotland, who are required by law to maintain gazetteer data. It also handles Scottish Roadworks Register associated data and road assets. roadNet comprises a number of tools. The Street Selector allows users to identify street records associated with each section of road, and to open them in the Street Browser. The Street Browser allows users to view and edit street records and, via the SRWR tab, their associated maintenance records. There are also tools to export the data in both GIS format (shapefile) and text formats (e.g. SDTF) used to submit data to the central authority. The RAMP tools extend roadNet by allowing ID numbers to be allocated to polygon data and easy updating of their attributes. See the roadNet homepage for more details. Requirements: python-qt4-sql

pyqgis_plugin.name: Greek Open Data
pyqgis_plugin.description: View Open Greek Web-services
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin is a collection of the most important publicly available web services (WMS + WFS) for Greece. It requires an internet connection. The plugin was created with the purpose of giving to the users the opportunity to easily have an overview of the available open datasets and to be able to quickly view and/or download them. CRS is GGRS87/Greek Grid (EPSG:2100)

pyqgis_plugin.name: JoinSplit
pyqgis_plugin.description: JoinSplit relates a spatial layer with a matrix sharing a common field, and export the selected fields from the matrix as spatial layers.
pyqgis_plugin.about: The JoinSplit works by performing a table join between a spatial layer and a matrix (opened as a table in QGIS), and it exports each field from the matrix, or only those selected by the user, as an individual shapefile. This plugin is useful when a matrix of presence or counts of multiple entities (e.g. species observations) are available with an grid identifier (e.g. UTM square, custom grid ID, intersection of lat/lon with a grid, etc). The JoinSplit opens all layers in the Table of Contents and the user may choose a style file (exported from any other shapefile) to show the new layers. The plugin includes an example data set (more details in the homepage).

pyqgis_plugin.name: Table to Style
pyqgis_plugin.description: Reads an attribute table (usually in dbf or text format) with pixel value information and attributes and creates a new style for raster display.
pyqgis_plugin.about: The Table2Style links an attribute table with pixel value colour information with a pixel value of a raster, displaying the raster as intended. The colour information is the red, green and blue values (from 0 to 1 or 0 to 255) and, optionally, the opacity. The plugin also creates a random color scheme for each pixel value, if no file is available. A simple example data set is provided.

pyqgis_plugin.name: LinzSnap
pyqgis_plugin.description: Plugin for displaying results from the LINZ SNAP program
pyqgis_plugin.about: Draws observations, stations, and adjustment vectors calculated using the Land Information New Zealand (LINZ) survey network adjustment package SNAP. SNAP is available at http://www.linz.govt.nz/data/geodetic-services/download-geodetic-software/snap-concord-downloads This plugin uses the Vector Field Renderer plugin to draw adjustment vectors and error ellipses.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Layer Style Loader
pyqgis_plugin.description: Load multiple layer styles based on layer names. Select a parent folder. Qml files in the subdirectories which match by layer name will get the style assigned.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Load multiple layer styles based on layer names.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Datafordeler
pyqgis_plugin.description: Easy access to the services from Datafordeleren

pyqgis_plugin.name: Polygon Comparator
pyqgis_plugin.description: Comparaison of polygon layer - first for classifcation purposes
pyqgis_plugin.about: light QGIS plugin for comparaison of two vector layer - done for classification validation purposes. The tool allows a straight-forward generation of a difference layer with a pdf containing the most common accuracy metrics as well as a short description of them.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Vietnamese Font Converter
pyqgis_plugin.description: This tool helps to convert charsets between encodings, from Vietnamese's UTF-8 to Internationalized (Unicode) and vice versa. For non-Vietnamese users, you can also use this tool to convert into ANSI characters (either "TCVN >> Khong dau" or "Unicode >> Khong dau".
pyqgis_plugin.about: Công cụ chuyển đổi mã font trong tiếng Việt. Một trong những đóng góp của ThanhGIS (thanh.nv@me.com) dành tặng người dùng QGIS Việt Nam.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Indiana Open Data Plugin
pyqgis_plugin.description: Provides access to approximately 300 vector layers and 30 TB imagery, LiDAR, Topographic maps, and Elevation data for the State of Indiana
pyqgis_plugin.about: Provides access to approximately 300 vector layers and 30 TB imagery, LiDAR, and Elevation data

pyqgis_plugin.name: RNC Loader
pyqgis_plugin.description: Lists Raster Nautical Charts by title.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Finds raster nautical charts in a root directory, such as BSB_ROOT, and lists them by title. US charts from NOAA may be obtained here: http://www.charts.noaa.gov/RNCs/RNCs.shtml

pyqgis_plugin.name: Direct Print From View
pyqgis_plugin.description: Print or export to a file (pdf), current map view using a composition.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin allows to print or export to a file (pdf) the current view of the map by using a previously created composer (you can choose which if there are more than one). It supports multiple compositions and does not change the scale in them.
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Martí Angelats i Ribera, Carlos Lopez Quintanilla

pyqgis_plugin.name: Khartes Tools
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin gathers the tools developed by Khartes Co.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Khartes Tools with the following features: - STL files building from Digital Elevation Models for 3d Printers.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Geoscopio Search
pyqgis_plugin.description: A plugin to interact with a web client from Geoscopio (RT) dedicated to search places through its geocoding engine
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin is for Geoscopio (http://www.regione.toscana.it/-/geoscopio) users, the online spatial data catalogue of Regione Toscana (Italy). The plugin will let users search places within a webview of the catalogue, synced with QGIS's map canvas.

pyqgis_plugin.name: History viewer for a PostgreSQL base with audit triggers
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin allows to view audit logs and replay some past events
pyqgis_plugin.about: History viewer for a PostgreSQL base with audit triggers

pyqgis_plugin.description: This is a test plugin for greeting the (going multiline) world, version is 2.3
pyqgis_plugin.about: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. pyqgis_plugin.name: Value Tool
pyqgis_plugin.description: Display in a table or plot the values from the visible raster layers at the current mouse position
pyqgis_plugin.about: Display raster layer values at current mouse position

pyqgis_plugin.name: Plugin Builder
pyqgis_plugin.description: Creates a QGIS plugin template for use as a starting point in plugin development
pyqgis_plugin.about: Create a template for a QGIS plugin

pyqgis_plugin.description: Stats and analysis for vector layers data

pyqgis_plugin.name: TimeManager
pyqgis_plugin.description: create animations visualizing spatio-temporal data
pyqgis_plugin.about: TimeManager adds time controls to QGIS. Using these time controls, you can animate vector features based on a time attribute. There is also an experimental raster layer support and support for interpolation beween point geometries. You can create animations directly in the map window and export image series.

pyqgis_plugin.name: GarminCustomMap
pyqgis_plugin.description: Export the current map canvas to a Garmin Custom Map (.kmz-file)
pyqgis_plugin.about: The GarminCustomMap plugin exports the current map canvas to a .kmz-file, which is compatible with Garmin`s Custom Maps format for handheld GPS units. That way individual maps styled in QGIS can be used as background (raster) maps on the compatible Garmin GPS units, like Alpha, Astro, Dakota, Oregon, Colorado, GPSMAP 62 series, GPSMAP 64 series, GPSMAP 78 series, Edge 800, Montana, Rino, eTrex® 20 and 30.
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Stefan Blumentrath - Norwegian Institute for Nature Research (NINA)

pyqgis_plugin.name: QConsolidate
pyqgis_plugin.description: Consolidate QGIS project into one directory

pyqgis_plugin.name: MultiEdit
pyqgis_plugin.description: MultiEdit chooses an attribute value from a vector layer and selecting the matching features, changes all the corresponding to a new value: useful if you have many features to modify.This plugin lets you write the new value in any existing field in the attribute table, for the selected features or newly created from plugin gui...
pyqgis_plugin.about: MultiEdit plugin for Qgis 2.x 2012 © Giuseppe De Marco This plugin is a python plugins that performs changing of attributes values of select features assigning the same value to all the selected item's atribute chosen in plugin gui. Added an options to select all the feature from a layer and set attribute's value to the one chosen in plugin's gui at once.

pyqgis_plugin.name: FlowMapper
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin generates flow lines between discreet nodes for visualising spatial interaction data (e.g. migration, trips).
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin generates flow lines between discrete nodes for depicting spatial interaction data (e.g. migration, traffic etc.). Plugin can generate Net/Gross/TwoWay flow lines based and also the flow nodes based on an interaction matrix and a pair of coordinates supplied in plain text (txt) format. All outputs are in shapefile format. Flow and node filtering capabilities are available as well as graduated symbology options. Test dataset and brief documentation is included.

pyqgis_plugin.name: TransMerc
pyqgis_plugin.description: The extreme reprojector to transverse mercator projection
pyqgis_plugin.about: This is a plugin for transforming the projections of vector layers to Transverse Mercator (TM) accurately and universally. The default projection engine of QGIS uses approximated Gauss Kruger Formulae for TM transformation, whose accuracy go worse or raise exceptions at places far away from the prime meridian (central longitude). Because this plugin uses the original formulae for transformation, it can perform TM transformation for any combination of geographical data and projection parameters.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Crayfish
pyqgis_plugin.description: Visualiser for temporal structured/unstructured grids in QGIS
pyqgis_plugin.about: The Crayfish plugin aspires to be a time explorer for various grid and vector datasets within QGIS. With Crayfish, users can load time varying mesh into QGIS. Currently, Crayfish supports a number of hydraulic modelling software packages which output results to XMDF, SMS DAT, GRIB, HEC2D, netCDF, Serafin, FLO-2D and SWW. Examples of the software packages are: TUFLOW, AnuGA, BASEMENT, ISIS 2D, HEC-RAS 2D, TELEMAC, FLO-2D and Hydro_AS 2D. Crayfish loads and renders results directly rather than converting them to GIS formats before viewing. This allows users to flick quickly through the various output steps in the result files and to create animations.

pyqgis_plugin.name: RT MapServer Exporter
pyqgis_plugin.description: Export QGIS project to MapFile. Developed with funding from Regione Toscana-SITA. Development of the Python-based (non-SLD) exporter was sponsored by ViaMap Ltd., Budapest, Hungary.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin helps to export a QGis Project as mapserver mapfile. It needs python-mapscript istalled in your machine. This is available as a Debian (therefore Ubuntu) package, and as a part of OSGeo4W on Windows. It sets main class, layer and symbols with some limitation. map file can be generated in two way: A) SLD based as interchange format among QGIS and Mapserver/Mapscript QGIS SLD have some features not covered by the interchange format transformation. B) Pure python Style/map file transformation that would cover mor style mapping !!!WARNING!!! In 0.4.0 was added SLD external graphic validation regexp. If you plan to add any external graphics (svg or pixmap) you MUST set a validation regexp otherwise you'll receive mapscript validation error. This will work only if your mapscript version supports sld_external_graphic validation. sld_external_graphic validation block is managed by mapserver in curent master version and will be officially released in mapserver 7.0.
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Giuseppe Sucameli - Luigi Pirelli (Faunalia) - Ádám Barancsuk (ViaMap Ltd.)

pyqgis_plugin.about: Developed by Luca Congedo, the Semi-Automatic Classification Plugin (SCP) allows for the supervised classification of remote sensing images, providing tools for the download, the preprocessing and postprocessing of images. pyqgis_plugin.name: LandXml import plugin
pyqgis_plugin.description: Import parcels and nodes from a LINZ LandXml file
pyqgis_plugin.about: The LandXml format is an Xml format used to transfer cadastral survey data. The format can describe cadastral survey parcels, nodes, and observations. This plugin is used to extract information from a LandXml data file into memory layers in the QGIS plugin. Currently it supports parcels and nodes, and observations. The plugin is designed to work with LandXml files generated by the Land Information New Zealand Landonline application - it may not support LandXml from other sources.

pyqgis_plugin.name: pyArchInit
pyqgis_plugin.description: pyarchinit archaeological tools: added logo system for PDF- tocheck
pyqgis_plugin.about:
To run properly the plugin you need to install before the following software and modules (on linux you can install through synaptic or other package manager): graphviz pygraphviz sqlalchemy reportlab pyper (optional for windows) matplotlib (probably installed with QGis) networkx(probably installed with QGis)
Here you will find the Windows installations instructions: https://sites.google.com/site/pyarchinit/downloads (coming soon the english version)
For any question: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/pyarchinit-users
The project “PyArchInit- python for archaeology” began in 2005 with the aim of developing a phyton’s plug-in for the open source software Qgis. PyArchinit comes mainly from the needs, ever more present in the archaeology community, to computerize the archaeological records using software, which handle alphanumeric, multimedia and topographical data in a single solution. This package aims to meet the requirements with a unique solution that guarantees over time stability, development, easy installation and update. The final goal is the creation of GIS platform with a high interoperability between different operating system, in which alphanumerical table, GIS geometries and multimedia data are within a single system. This allows to keep as much as possible the integrity of the raw data, providing to the archaeologist both a very fast and robust approach and, in meantime, it is an open system to changes and customizations by other developers. The database management system of archaeological data is automatically installed both in Postgresql and in Spatialite. Different GUI, created to support of entering data, manage the database. It is structured in seven management GUI: Stratigraphic units Site Chronology Infrastructures Taphonomy Record Archaeological Multimedia The first part of the package includes the management of stratigraphic units (pyarchnit_US) because of the need to manage on situ the documentation of on going excavations. With pyArchInit we will try to bridge the gap between skills and knowledge acquired on an Academic level and daily life of archaeological fieldworks; moreover it will help the interaction with engineers, urban planners, government, Cultural Office administrators and all the agencies that gravitate around archaeological world.

pyqgis_plugin.name: geopunt4Qgis
pyqgis_plugin.description: NL: Plugin om geopunt diensten in QGIS te gebruiken: - Zoeken op adres [gewoon, in batch en prikken op kaart] op basis van CRAB (Vlaanderen) en URBIS (Brussel) - Zoeken naar Intressepunten in geopunt - zoeken naar wegenwerken en manifestaties in GIPOD - Hoogte Profielen tekenen - Zoeken naar percelen - Zoeken naar lagen in de geopunt catlogus EN: Plug-in to use geopunt services in QGIS: - Geocoding [regular, batch and reverse] based on CRAB (Flanders) and and URBIS (Brussels) - Search for POI's in geopunt - Search for trafic obstructions in GIPOD - Draw elevation profiles - Search for Parcels - Search for layers in the geopunt catalog
pyqgis_plugin.about:
geopunt4Qgis - "Geopunt voor QGIS" is een plugin voor de QGIS open source desktop GIS, die de webservices van het Vlaamse geoportaal Geopunt ontsluit naar desktop GIS-gebruikers.
Het Vlaamse Geoportaal Geopunt biedt een aantal geografische diensten (web-services) aan die mogen gebruikt worden door derden zoals andere overheden en bedrijven.
De kaartdiensten zijn gebaseerd op de OGC open standaard WMS of WMTS en kunnen gemakkelijk worden toegevoegd aan desktop GIS. GIS-gebruikers kunnen deze diensten ontdekken via het metadatacenter. De achterliggende zoekservice voor deze diensten is niet direct bruikbaar in QGIS en wordt in deze plugin ingebouwd.

pyqgis_plugin.name: PPConverter
pyqgis_plugin.description: Convert PhoToPlan-images to GeoTIFFs
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin is supposed to convert images created within the AutoCAD©-Plugin PhoToPlan© (regularly used, for example, in archaeological excavations). The user has to specify the locations of the original image and where to save the newly created GeoTiff. The plugin checks for the presence of the accompanying ppb-file and automatically determines if the image stems from a planum or a profile. In the latter case, the X- and Y-values are ignored and the origin of the GeoTIFF is set to "0/Z-value". Finally, the plugin opens the new file in QGIS. The user then has to choose the correct projection, as this cannot be determined from the ppb-file.

pyqgis_plugin.name: teamqgis
pyqgis_plugin.description: Supports digitizing training and validation data from remote sensing imagery. Based on the "itembrowser" plugin by Denis Rouzaud.
pyqgis_plugin.about:
teamqgis is a Quantum GIS (QGIS) plugin to support digitizing training and validation data for image classifications. The plugin was created to support the work of the Tropical Ecology Assessment and Monitoring (TEAM) Network. The TEAM Network is a global network of sites in tropical forests focused on collecting standardized real-time data measuring the response of tropical forests to changing climate, land cover and land use, and population.
teamqgis is based off of the itembrowser plugin created by Denis Rouzaud.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Viewshed Analysis
pyqgis_plugin.description: Advanced visibility analysis tool.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Viewshed analysis calculates visible surface from a given observer point over a digital elevation model. This plugin is native to QGIS and intended for more complex modelling, such as the depth below the visible horizon or generation of intervisibilty networks between groups of points. It is particularly performant for multiple viewshed calculations form a set of fixed points. For single point, large area viewsheds the algorithms already available in QGIS (GRASS r.los or SAGA viewshed module) would do the job.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Transectizer
pyqgis_plugin.description: Transectizer is a QGIS plugin which provides an easy way to design linear transects with sampling stations distributed at a given distance along the transect.
pyqgis_plugin.about:
You can find Transectizer under Vector > Transectizer
Transectizer is a QGIS plugin which provides an easy way to design linear transects with sampling stations distributed at a given distance along the transect.
You can manually set the initial point and the bearing of the transect or you can interactivelly set it with the help of the mouse. Also, if you have a GPS connection enabled, you can get your coordinates from it.
Transectizer makes possible to automatically generate each individual station details (transect name, station name, station number) or have control over all the attributes of each station.
You can store your transects in a new layer or provide an existing layer for it. In that case, Transectizer will make the appropiate changes to your layer to make it compatible with Transectizer.

pyqgis_plugin.about: The plugin is dedicated to Geosud data. However, it should be used for satellite images acquired in other ways. It converts Digital Numbers (DN) to Top of Atmosphere (ToA) Reflectance for five types of instrument : Landsat 8, RapidEye, Spot 5, Spot 6/7 and Pleaides.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Quick Export
pyqgis_plugin.description: Quick Export adds a new toolbar in QGIS, with 4 actions to export any vector layer to CSV, HTML, PDF and printer.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Walking time
pyqgis_plugin.description: Calculate walking travel time from linestring vector layer, based on slope derived from an elevation raster
pyqgis_plugin.about: The Walking time is a QGIS python plugin that uses Tobbler’s hiking function to estimate the travel time along a line depending on the slope. The input data required are a vector layer with lines and a raster layer with elevation values. One can adjust the base velocity (on flat terrain) according to the type of walking or walker. By default, the value used is 5 km \ h. The plugin update or create fields with estimated time in minutes in forward and in reverse direction. One can run the plugin for all elements of the vector layer, or only on selected routes. The plugin can also been used to prepare a network (graph) to perform network analysis when the use of travel walking time as cost is intended.

pyqgis_plugin.name: opeNoise
pyqgis_plugin.description: opeNoise allows to compute the noise level generated by road traffic at fixed receiver points and buildings.

pyqgis_plugin.name: go2streetview
pyqgis_plugin.description: The plugin allows to get a window with Google Street View or Bing Bird's Eye clicking and dragging the cursor on map to set location and direction of the desired view.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Go2streetview allows to get a window with Google Street View or Bing Bird's Eye clicking and dragging the cursor on map to set location and direction of the desired view. Features: Automatic SRS conversion, Transparent proxying, View position on map, Take Snapshots of current view, Dockable Dialog Windows, Overlay info layer support, Map follows Streetview, Streetview service coverage

pyqgis_plugin.name: Watermark Plugin

pyqgis_plugin.name: Unique_values_saver

pyqgis_plugin.name: geovallecvc
pyqgis_plugin.description: PlugIn para QGIS - Modelo Geoidal CVC del Valle del Cauca
pyqgis_plugin.about:
PlugIn para QGIS - Modelo Geoidal CVC del Valle del Cauca
Este plugin para QGIS entrega la ondulación geoidal para puntos de entrada en diferentes sistemas de referencia en el Valle del Cauca, para su calculo hace uso del Geoide local (GEOVALLE 1.0) (Opensource) desarrollado por la coorporación autonoma regional (CVC). Más información sobre el modelo geoidal GEOVALLE 1.0 en http://www.cvc.gov.co/

This plugin is useful for searching a database of locations or assets and zooming to that location. So users get the experience of autocomplete in QGIS.
Before using the plugin you will need to edit the postgis.ini file to tell the plugin which database and table to search.
More details on "How To" can be found here http://tjmgis.github.io/PostGISSearch/

pyqgis_plugin.name: Circuitscape for Processing
pyqgis_plugin.description: Predict connectivity in heterogeneous landscapes
pyqgis_plugin.about: Circuitscape is a free software package that borrows algorithms from electronic circuit theory to predict connectivity in heterogeneous landscapes. Its most common applications include modeling movement and gene flow of plants and animals, as well as identifying areas important for connectivity conservation. Developed by Alexander Bruy for Faunalia (http://faunalia.eu) funded by Prof. António Mira (University of Évora, Portugal, Unidade de Biologia da Conservação) and Dr. Rosana Peixoto PhD. Requires QGIS >= 2.3.0

pyqgis_plugin.name: Pic2Map
pyqgis_plugin.description: Compute the 3D orientation of a picture and provide the interaction between the picture and the map.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Pic2map has two goals. First, it is used to compute the orientation of a picture with 3D Ground Control Points. The orientation can be saved in a Google Earth format. Second, it provides the interaction between the map and the picture through a Digital Elevation Model. Vector layers can be overlaid on the picture, geographic vector layer can be digitized directly in the picture, the picture can be "orthorectified".

pyqgis_plugin.name: LOUIS Map Biographer

pyqgis_plugin.about: The goal for LOUIS Map Biographer is to provide the quality and elegance of paper based interviews but deliver real time and cost savings by allowing effective and rapid direct-to-digital data capture by a single interviewer. This version is not compatible with releases before 1.0.8
pyqgis_plugin.tags: interviews,traditional land use,heritage,indigenous,local knowledge,traditional knowledge,use and occupancy mapping,aboriginal

pyqgis_plugin.name: OpenQuake Integrated Risk Modelling Toolkit
pyqgis_plugin.description: Tools for the development of composite indicators measuring societal characteristics and the integration of these with physical risk estimations
pyqgis_plugin.about: <p>Tools for creating and editing indicators and composite indices to measure social characteristics and for combining these with estimates of physical earthquake risk (i.e. estimates of human or infrastructure loss).</p><p>The plugin enables users to directly interact with the <ahref='https://platform.openquake.org'>OpenQuake Platform</a>, in order to browse and download socioeconomic data or existing projects, to edit projects locally in QGIS, then to upload and share them through the Platform.</p><p>This plugin was designed as a collaborative effort between the <a href='http://www.globalquakemodel.org'>GEM Foundation</a> and the <a href='http://www.cedim.de/english/'>Center for Disaster Management and Risk Reduction Technology</a>, and it has been developed by the GEM Foundation. It was formerly named GEM OpenQuake Social Vulnerability and Integrated Risk (SVIR)</p>

pyqgis_plugin.name: Search & format EPSG CRS Plugin
pyqgis_plugin.description: Plugin to search and format a coordinate reference system (CRS) in a wide variety of formats: prettywkt, wkt, mapnik, sql, esriwkt, js, proj4, gml, xml, geoserver, mapserver, etc. Searches are made on the basis of a valid EPSG code. The Plugin can also retrieve the available transformations list for a CRS as well as other basic information about the CRS, as area, type and official name. This plugin uses great website EPSG.io (http://epsg.io/). The EPSG.io website is built around the official EPSG database maintained by OGP Geomatics Committee.
pyqgis_plugin.about:
Plugin to search and format a coordinate reference system (CRS) in a wide variety of formats: prettywkt, wkt, mapnik, sql, esriwkt, js, proj4, gml, xml, geoserver, mapserver, etc. Searches are made on the basis of a valid EPSG code. pyqgis_plugin.tags: mastermap,os,address layer,address layer 2,master map,gml,postgis,topography layer,gml gz,load,loader,itn,sites layer,convert,gml.gz,addresslayer2,postgresql,translate,pg,import,gz,ordnance survey,integrated transport network

pyqgis_plugin.name: Vertige horizontal
pyqgis_plugin.description:
This plugin automatically detects horizontal and vertical lines using linestring vector layer as inputs.
Different thresholds can be set : 50% (0.5) is the default value for vertical and horizontal detections. It means that to be detected as vertical a line has to be half wide than high. Remainder is detected as diagonal (with a large threshold : 90% as default value).
This plugin is a very basic spatial analysis of networks. As result, a new field hori_verti is created and reflects the detection : v for vertical, h for horizontal, d as diagonal, u as undefined.

pyqgis_plugin.name: PostGIS geoprocessing tools
pyqgis_plugin.description: A set of tools to do geoprocessing with PostGIS layers. The spatial SQL queries are run in the server where the layers come from, and the result will be a PostGIS layer (created directly in the server where the inputs come from) and not a shapefile as usually in the Processing toolbox. The plugin is experimental and in the future it will benefit from a number of improvements that will be made in the QGIS Processing toolbox.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Developed by Giovanni Manghi for NaturalGIS (http://www.naturalgis.pt/) with the help of Alexander Bruy (alexander.bruy@gmail.com)

pyqgis_plugin.name: HyShell

pyqgis_plugin.name: Slicer

pyqgis_plugin.about: SLICER is a plugin developed for version 2.0 of QGIS, which aims to make the slicing (reclassification) of a raster, generating a new numerical grid, with its pixels grouped in classes that were determined by slices (pixel value range). This procedure is very useful, for example, for making relief and hypsometric class maps.

pyqgis_plugin.about: Summary of raster data can be view as histogram. The standard tool of QGIS allow to display a fine histogram for each band. Modification on image brightness or contrast is similar to a modification of histogram. More than contrast enhancement, PLCS bring the capability to do histogram equalization, hand-classification or color adjustment. It's also possible to use it in batch mode for a whole folder. Use the mouse-left button to drag breakpoints on histogram, and mouse-right button to add or delete breakpoints
