pyqgis_plugin.description: Automatically adds images that are in the catalog layer that intersect with the map area.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin work with catalog layer. Catalog layer need be the polygon layer and have two fields, source image(string) and date of image(date). This plugin is developed on the demand of IBAMA(Brazilian Institute of Environment and Renewable Natural Resources) http://www.ibama.gov.br See the presentations: - http://pt.slideshare.net/LuizMotta3/presentation-2015-0701ibamaplugins - http://pt.slideshare.net/LuizMotta3/presentation-2015-0715ibamacatalootfinactions

pyqgis_plugin.name: beePen
pyqgis_plugin.description: Allows to draw freehand lines in a layer
pyqgis_plugin.about: Plugin for drawing freehand lines with map-specified pen widths. Its applications are for field mapping. It is based on the "Freehand" plugin.

pyqgis_plugin.name: GML Loader
pyqgis_plugin.description: Load GML using OGR with customized config options
pyqgis_plugin.about: QGIS is able to load GML without any additional plugin. You can use this plugin to load GML using OGR with "hidden" options like GML_SKIP_RESOLVE_ELEMS or GML_ATTRIBUTES_TO_OGR_FIELDS.

pyqgis_plugin.name: OSMDownloader
pyqgis_plugin.description: Plugin to download OSM data by area, using a selection by rectangle. The plugin can also automatically load the osm file into QGIS in a transparent way.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This a simple and quick way to download OSM data. All the processing is made in a separate thread and thereby QGIS is not block while downloading. The osm file can be automatically loaded after download.

pyqgis_plugin.name: STEM
pyqgis_plugin.description: Sistema di TElerilevamento e di Monitoraggio del territorio e dell'ambiente trentino
pyqgis_plugin.about: Plugin to analize hyperspectral and lidar data for Provincia Autonoma di Trento, Italian language is used for plugin interface
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Ermanno Moser, Francesco Lago, Francesco Nex, Luca Delucchi, Martino Salvetti, Michele Dalponte, Pietro Zambelli, Salvatore Larosa, Massimiliano Zurli

pyqgis_plugin.name: qgis2web
pyqgis_plugin.description: Export to an OpenLayers 3/Leaflet webmap
pyqgis_plugin.about: qgis2web generates a web map from your current QGIS project, either as OpenLayers3 or Leaflet. It replicates as many aspects of the project as it can, including layers, styles (including categorized and graduated), and extent. No server-side software required.
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Tom Chadwin, Riccardo Klinger, Victor Olaya

pyqgis_plugin.name: smartroadsense
pyqgis_plugin.description: smartroadsense
pyqgis_plugin.about: SmartRoadSense plugin for QuantumGIS .

pyqgis_plugin.name: Load QSS - UI themes
pyqgis_plugin.description: Configure look and feel for Qgis.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Load QSS allows the user to load his/her own *.qss files and change the look and feel of Qgis.Some examples o predefined themes are provided.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Elevation Viewer
pyqgis_plugin.description: Allows easy extrapolation from a vector elevation layer to determine the elevation between two points
pyqgis_plugin.about: Allows easy extrapolation from a vector elevation layer to determine the elevation between two points. The user is prompted to select two points between which elevation will be measured. This information, along with the layer on which the vector-elevation data resides, the attribute that represents the elevation, and selection of a suitable projection allows the elevation to be determined. The result is a 2D "side view" with a line representing line-of-sight between the two points, overlaid on a "terrain" view.

pyqgis_plugin.name: relocator
pyqgis_plugin.description: relocates all your project data to a specific location
pyqgis_plugin.about: relocator uses your current qgis project and exports all your local layers to a desired directory and copy and adjust your current project file. Furthermore you can create a zip of your project for easy sharing.

pyqgis_plugin.name: DateControl
pyqgis_plugin.description: Displays vector data within specified date range
pyqgis_plugin.about: Displays vector data within specified date. The range may move backwards or forwards by a specified amount at regular intervals or it may be set manually. Each record in the vector data may have a start and end date or a single date. BC dates are allowed. This plugin is suitable for historical reconstructions.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Data Analysis and Visualization
pyqgis_plugin.description: Calculate and show statistical properties for a field
pyqgis_plugin.about: Data Explorer is aimed at plotting and/or analysing data series, with particular enphasis on time series. The plugin structure has been partially mutuated by the plugin \

pyqgis_plugin.name: twitter2qgis
pyqgis_plugin.description: Collects tweets by area or keywords.
pyqgis_plugin.about: twitter2qgis/geotweet collects tweets and store them in a shapefile. You need to install tweepy prior usage and create API keys in your twitter account!

pyqgis_plugin.name: Flow Estimator
pyqgis_plugin.description: Estimates steady, uniform flow using the Manning equation for trapezoidal and DEM sampled channels. Intended for use by engineers and hydrologists. Requires shapely, numpy, and matplotlib libraires
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: M. Weier - North Dakota State Water Commision

pyqgis_plugin.name: Editable GeoCSV
pyqgis_plugin.description: Load, edit and save GeoCSV files
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin allows files in GeoCSV format to be loaded, edited and saved in QGIS including geometry. This allows to integrate QGIS with spreadsheet programs like LibreOffice.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Layer Board
pyqgis_plugin.description: View and edit vector and raster properties for the project layers in a table
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin helps to see and modify properties for vector and raster layers. It shows the layers in a table sheet, and the user can directly modify some properties such as layer name, title, abstract, minimum and maximum scales. Some actions can be performed on multiple layers at once, such as modifying spatial reference system and scale based visibility. The layers information can be exported to Comma Separated Values (CSV).

pyqgis_plugin.name: pktools
pyqgis_plugin.description: Processing kernel for geospatial data

pyqgis_plugin.name: Spreadsheet Layers
pyqgis_plugin.description: Load layers from spreadsheet files (*.ods, *.xls, *.xlsx)
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin adds a "Add spreadsheet layer" entry in "Layer" / "Add new Layer" menu and a corresponding button in the "Layers" toolbar. These two links open the same dialog to load a layer from a spreadsheet file (*.ods, *.xls, *.xlsx) with some options (use header at first line, ignore some rows and optionally load geometry from x and y fields). When this dialog is accepted, it creates a new GDAL VRT file in same folder as the source data file, expanded with a .vrt suffix which is loaded into QGIS using OGR VRT driver. When reusing the same file twice, the dialog loads its values from the existing .vrt file. No need to install additional dependencies.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Customize ToolBars
pyqgis_plugin.description: Create customs Toolbars for Qgis.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin allows to create personalized tools, with the buttons the user desires. It is only necessary dragging from the list on the left and dropping in the list on the right, the tools that the user desires to add to any of the previously created toolbars.

pyqgis_plugin.name: OSM route
pyqgis_plugin.description: OpenRouteService routing for QGIS
pyqgis_plugin.about: OSM route will allow you routing from A to B via C for different ways of travel. Furthermore you can make an accessability analysis. Powered by OpenRouteService.org

pyqgis_plugin.name: SOS Client
pyqgis_plugin.description: OGC Sensor Observation Service Client
pyqgis_plugin.about: SOS Client alows QGIS to request sensors observations data from QGC Sensor Observation Service server

pyqgis_plugin.name: photo2kmz
pyqgis_plugin.description: get lat-lng from photo to create kmz(attach photo) file and csv file.
pyqgis_plugin.about: To apply for teaching GIS beginner course. Project "water subdistrict management in thailand"

pyqgis_plugin.name: Toggle Active Layer
pyqgis_plugin.description: Plugin for toggle visibility of active layer
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin is a tool for toggle visibility of active layer, for example, you can see the difference with others layers below, when pressed and released. See presentation in http://pt.slideshare.net/LuizMotta3/presentation-2015-0701ibamaplugins This plugin is developed on the demand of IBAMA(Brazilian Institute of Environment and Renewable Natural Resources) http://www.ibama.gov.br

pyqgis_plugin.name: Auxiliary Window
pyqgis_plugin.description: Plugin for open synchronized window with selected layers
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin for open synchronized window with selected layers. This plugin is similar the "Dockable MirrorMap" plugin, but, the diference is this plugin create a new main window, and not a dockbale window. The plugin have others features. The new window can add, remove, show, hide the layers. The tools in new windows enable, show the cursor from main window(QGIS window), set the scale, show the extent of main window. See presentation in http://pt.slideshare.net/LuizMotta3/presentation-2015-0701ibamaplugins This plugin is developed on the demand of IBAMA(Brazilian Institute of Environment and Renewable Natural Resources) http://www.ibama.gov.br

pyqgis_plugin.name: RASOR Plugin
pyqgis_plugin.description: Plugin developed for the FP7 RASOR Project (http://www.rasor-project.eu/)
pyqgis_plugin.about: Able to generate RASOR compliant layers and upload them to the platform. OSM support in future releases.

pyqgis_plugin.name: swath profile
pyqgis_plugin.description: Creates an aggregate profile along a baseline
pyqgis_plugin.about: Generates a table with aggregates on an "averaged" swath profile along a baseline. Useful if you want a statistical profile of an entire river, or along other features. Uses the method described in Hergarten et.al. (2014) "Extracting topographic swath profiles across curved geomorphic features".

pyqgis_plugin.name: CLUZ
pyqgis_plugin.description: CLUZ for QGIS
pyqgis_plugin.about: The CLUZ (Conservation Land-Use Zoning) plugin lets people design protected area networks and other conservation landscapes and seascapes through on-screen conservation planning. It also acts as an interface for the Marxan software package.
pyqgis_plugin.tags: systematic conservation planning,gap analysis,marxan,spatial conservation prioritisation

pyqgis_plugin.name: Catalog Planet Labs
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin lets you get images from the Planet Labs API.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin lets you get images from the Planet Labs API, by performing searches for images that intersect with the extent of the map window. It is a product from Planet Explorers program (https://www.planet.com/explorers/), it is not an official Planet Labs's plugin. You need a key from Planet Labs in order to use this plugin. This plugin will be create polygon layer (Catalog of images) from intersect with the extent of the map window. With this plugin, you can download full images, visual or analytic, thumbnail images or add TMS images. See presentation in http://pt.slideshare.net/LuizMotta3/planetlabs-explorer-qgisplugin

pyqgis_plugin.name: Plugin Mapotempo
pyqgis_plugin.description: Plugin for Mapotempo API
pyqgis_plugin.about: Mapotempo QGis Plugin (MapotempoPlugin) is a plugin which can access to Mapotempo data through QGis software. Mapotempo is a planning and optimization web software for delivery tours. Effective for light and heavy vehicles (+ 3.5t)

pyqgis_plugin.name: SaTSviz_2
pyqgis_plugin.description: SaTSviz aims to provide QGIS an additional feature of analysis by utilising SaTScan. All input files needed for SaTScan are created by the plugin and the output files form it are read by the plugin and fed in to QGIS to visualise the analysis results. This plugin provides benefit to both the softwares.
pyqgis_plugin.about: SaTSviz aims to provide QGIS an additional feature of analysis by utilising SaTScan. All input files needed for SaTScan are created by the plugin and the output files form it are read by the plugin and fed in to QGIS to visualise the analysis results. This plugin provides benefit to both the softwares.
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Vasuda Trehan under guidance of Shiva Reddy Kotti

pyqgis_plugin.name: Bulk vector export as SLD and GeoJson
pyqgis_plugin.description: Export all vector layers as geoJson and SLD.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin exports all vector layers as geoJson with their SLD styling. The resulting files are zipped into a file named after the qgis project. The layer ordering and additional information is stored in a metadata.json.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Smart editing tools
pyqgis_plugin.description: Get some tools!
pyqgis_plugin.about: Smart angles, brainy spining, awesome editing makes your vector drawing happy!

pyqgis_plugin.name: QBAN(O)
pyqgis_plugin.description: QBAN(O) permet de géolocaliser vos adresses issues d'un fichier excel ou CSV. Il se sert de la base BAN (Base Adresse Nationale).
pyqgis_plugin.about: Le fichier des adresses doit être ouvert dans Qgis. L'adresse doit être contenue dans une seule colonne (numero, rue, code postal, ville). Une fois la géolocalisation effectuée, une colonne "score" permet de connaitre la fiabilité de l'adresse, 1 étant la meilleure note (à partir de 0,5, la localisation est fiable).

pyqgis_plugin.name: d3 Map Renderer
pyqgis_plugin.description: Export vector layers to a d3.js map, with optional popup information, charts and legend
pyqgis_plugin.about: A python QGIS plugin to export polygons, polylines and point vector layers from shapefiles to topojson for display within a web page using the d3.js JavaScript library, with additional options of popup information based on d3-tip, charts from c3.js and a legend. The aim of the plugin is not to replicate all of the mapping functionality available within d3, nor is it to provide every type of chart or data visualisation. The plugin aims to provide you with the a solid starting point to start hacking the JavaScript code. For instance, you may want to use a different charting library, remove the y or x axis from the current chart, use a different projection, alter the map size or color scheme. The log messages panel in QGIS will contain the topojson command used to convert the shapefile to topojson, and can be used as a template to hand craft your own conversions. NOTE: Pre-requisite of Node.js and the topojson package.

pyqgis_plugin.name: GMSH
pyqgis_plugin.description: This is a plugin to interract with the GMSH mesh generator (see http://geuz.org/gmsh).
pyqgis_plugin.about: Generate geometry input files for the GMSH mesh generator (http://geuz.org/gmsh) and convert the GMSH mesh file to shapefiles that can be imported into QGIS. The nightly snaphshot(http://geuz.org/gmsh/#Download) version of GMSH is required to mesh the generated .geo files. For more details, see this tutorial : https://github.com/ccorail/qgis-gmsh/wiki.

pyqgis_plugin.name: DEMto3D
pyqgis_plugin.description: 3D Printing of terrain models.
pyqgis_plugin.about: DEMto3D is the first tool that links GIS (Geographic Information System) and 3D printing. DEMto3D allows export DEM to STL format ready to 3D printing.

pyqgis_plugin.name: FFT Convolution Filters
pyqgis_plugin.description: Smoothing and edge detection based on fftconvolve() SciPy function
pyqgis_plugin.about: Smoothing and edge detection based on fftconvolve() SciPy function, as included in the gaussian_blur() function by Mike Toews (http://gis.stackexchange.com/a/10467). The edge detection is implemented by subtracting the smoothed raster from the original one. NumPy, SciPy and Rasterio python modules are needed.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Open Aerial Map (OAM)
pyqgis_plugin.description: Open Aerial Map (OAM) client to upload, search, and download imagery and metadata
pyqgis_plugin.about: OpenAerialMap QGIS plugin allows QGIS users to communicate with various OAM services, acting as a desktop client for OAM. Through this plugin, users can upload, search, and download imagery, as well as create and edit OIN-conformed metadata in a simple way. It also supports some raster image processing such as reprojection and file format conversion, as well as triggering the creation of tile services.

pyqgis_plugin.name: INSPIRE Nederland plugin voor QGIS
pyqgis_plugin.description: A tool to query INSPIRE datasets of the Dutch national dataportal "National Georegistry (NGR)" and add it to QGIS. - Een tool om de INSPIRE datasets uit het Nationaal Georegister te bevragen en toe te voegen aan QGIS.
pyqgis_plugin.about: In Nederland zijn inmiddels zijn meer dan 350 datasets en bijbehorende services geregistreerd in het Nationaal Georegister (http://www.nationaalgeoregister.nl/) als INSPIRE dataset of service. Om het gebruik te vergemakkelijken voor de professionele GIS-gebruikers in Nederland worden voor de twee meest gebruikte GIS software pakketten – te weten QGIS en ArcGIS Desktop – plugins ontwikkeld. Deze plugins maken het gemakkelijk om direct via het Nationaal Georegister de INSPIRE datasets en services te vinden, te raadplegen en te downloaden. Deze plugin is de QGIS-versie.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Complex GML Info
pyqgis_plugin.description: Display the featureinfo of complex GML featuretypes.

pyqgis_plugin.name: ROIExplorer
pyqgis_plugin.description: QGIS Plugin for exploring the spectral signatures of ROIs
pyqgis_plugin.about: QGIS Plugin for exploring the spectral signatures of regions of interests (ROI). Users may visualize the mean and standard deviations of spectral signatures from a raster image of pixels within selected polygons. Features within the vector dataset will be grouped together if they share the same value within the field indicated by the "Aggregate features by field" drop down box. This plugin is meant to be useful for investigating spectral signatures associated with training data input to a land cover classification. Changing the field specified by the "Aggregate features by field" drop down box allows users to plot within- or between-group spectral signatures. For example, a field named "landcover" may be used to distinguish across spectral signature groups while a label "sample_number" might distinguish different polygons within the same group.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Layer Metadata Dock
pyqgis_plugin.description: An alternative layer dock panel for quick access to basic layer metadata.
pyqgis_plugin.about: <p>This plugin adds a dock which you can use to group layers by a number of factors, like CRS, geometry type, extent etc.</p><p>You can access metadata across layers more easily, and copy values to the clipboard with Ctrl-C.</p><p>Access the dock using <b>View > Panels > Layer Metadata</b></p>

pyqgis_plugin.name: PosiView
pyqgis_plugin.description: PosiView tracks multiple mobile objects and vehicles and displays their position on the canvas
pyqgis_plugin.about: Track multiple objects and vehicles and display them as shapes and points on the canvas

pyqgis_plugin.name: AmigoCloud
pyqgis_plugin.description: AmigoCloud
pyqgis_plugin.about: The AmigoCloud plugin allows to connect QGIS to AmigoCloud backend using AmigoCloud GDAL data source

pyqgis_plugin.name: Dynamic Layers
pyqgis_plugin.description: Change the datasource of chosen layers dynamically by searching and replacing user defined variables.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin helps to change the datasources of many layers at once, for example to create different versions of the same project on different extents. You can use some variables such as {$myvar} inside the layer datasource, and then define theses variables (from a table or from an input vector source). Finally you apply the variables values on every configured layer via the apply button, and you can see the changes before saving the project. Documentation : https://github.com/3liz/QgisDynamicLayersPlugin/blob/master/README.md

pyqgis_plugin.name: Super_Copier
pyqgis_plugin.description: Copies objects with ability to customize the value of the field
pyqgis_plugin.about: Used to bind fields with names of different columns or pre-populate a field.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Create Indexed Vector Grid
pyqgis_plugin.description: Creates a vector polygon grid with named cells.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This is similar to the normal "Make vector grid", but cells are named in a spreadsheet-style format. This plugin can be used to create grids for street atlas indexes, by spatially joining features to their named cells.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Literature Mapper
pyqgis_plugin.description: Add spatial locations to the citations in your Zotero database.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Literature Mapper inserts geoJSON geometry strings into an online Zotero database to facilitate the mapping of study site locations. The locations stored in the database are displayed on the map canvas in virtual point and multipoint shapefiles on start up.

pyqgis_plugin.name: ExportGeopaparazzi
pyqgis_plugin.description: Just another Geopaparazzi database exporter
pyqgis_plugin.about: If you encountered problems with Kmzgeopapaimport and GeopaparazziTags converter, try this minimal plugin. Look for your *.gpap file in your harddisk and it will add layers (notes, image positions, bookmarks and tracklogs) directly to the map. Note that all the layers are "in memory", so you have to save them if you want store them. Images are saved in a new "images" folder in the same directory of the Geopaparazzi database. An action is added to the "image positions" layer in order to open the picture linked to each point.

pyqgis_plugin.name: MapSwipe Tool
pyqgis_plugin.description: Swipe active layer with others layers
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin is a map tool for swipe active layer, for example, you can see the difference with others layers below. The active layer, or group, will appear above all others. This plugin is developed of collaborative form with IBAMA [1] and APPLIED TECHNOLOGY CO., LTD [2]. [1] http://www.ibama.gov.br [2] http://www.apptec.co.jp See presentation in http://pt.slideshare.net/LuizMotta3/mapswipetool-plugin

pyqgis_plugin.name: Spatial Subset Query tool
pyqgis_plugin.description: EN: Make a spatial query on postgis database that selects a subset from a dataset based on the intersection with a geometry from an other preselected dataset in the same database. NL: Maak ruimtelijke query die een subset van een dataset op selecteert op basis van de intersectie met een gepreselecteerde laag overeenkomstig bij een bepaalde waarde.
pyqgis_plugin.about: A tool developed for the Flemish Environment Agency (Vlaamse Milieu Maatschappij VMM). The Database needs be configured before it can be used. Dit is een tool ontwikkelt voor Vlaamse Milieu Maatschappij (VMM). De databank instellingen moeten worden geconfigureerd voordat hij gebruik kan worden.

pyqgis_plugin.name: shp2D3
pyqgis_plugin.description: Convert an ESRI shapefile to 3D using a DEM
pyqgis_plugin.about: Converts ESRI shapefile vector map to 3D by sampling of elevation raster map. It use the pyshp library (https://github.com/GeospatialPython/pyshp). - Actually works only for PolyLine. Further development will include also Point and Polygons. http://www.gter.it
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: roberto marzocchi, roberta fagandini, tiziano cosso (Gter srl)

pyqgis_plugin.name: Basis NL
pyqgis_plugin.description: Extends processing framework to create and fill spatialite databases from zipped XML-files holding Basis Registration Geodata of the Netherlands.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Processes big zipped XML-files with free geodata that can not be imported directly in QGIS, it needs to be processed first. This version contains only 1 algorithm to process BAG (buildings and addresses). Works currently only on Windows and Linux OS. More algorithms will be provided soon to import other Basis Registration Geodata and do some post-processing as well.

pyqgis_plugin.name: ProMaiDes DEM Export
pyqgis_plugin.description: Create and export ProMaIDes DEM raster files
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin allows you to create and export multiple DEM raster files in the format requested by ProMaIDes, an integrated flood risk decision support system.

pyqgis_plugin.name: TRMM Data Downloader
pyqgis_plugin.description: Download and aggregate TRMM data to create thematic maps.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Daily data are available from January 1st 1998 to July 31st 2015.

pyqgis_plugin.name: LAPIG Tool
pyqgis_plugin.description: LAPIG Tools is a tool set in order to analyze geographic information and process satellite images (satellite, UAV's).In the version 0.3.0 were added tools:Saviztky Golay Filter
pyqgis_plugin.about: In development

pyqgis_plugin.name: WKT Bulk Loader
pyqgis_plugin.description: A plugin to bulk load WKT files
pyqgis_plugin.about: Give this plugin a directory and it will load all the .wkt files in it

pyqgis_plugin.name: Differential Privacy
pyqgis_plugin.description: Methods for anonymizing data for public distribution
pyqgis_plugin.about: This QGIS Processing provider plugin implements different methods for the anonymization of spatial data (typically point samples) with the goal of making the data publicly available, while preserving the privacy of the individuals whose information the dataset contains (see [3]). The differential privacy algorithm is based on the algorithm outlined in [1] and implemented by Konstantinos Chatzikokolakis in the Location Guard browser extension [2]. The grid based masking system is discussed in [4]. Credits [1] Andrés, M.E., Bordenabe, N.E., Chatzikokolakis, K., and Palamidessi, P. 2013. 'Geo-indistinguishability: Differential Privacy for Location-Based Systems', In the Proceedings of the 2013 ACM SIGSAC conference on Computer and Communications Security (CCS'13). New York, New York, USA: ACM Press, pp. 901–914. [2] https://github.com/chatziko/location-guard [3] Dwork, C. & Roth, A., 2014. The Algorithmic Foundations of Differential Privacy. Foundations and Trends® in Theoretical Computer Science, 9(3-4), pp.211–407. [4] Seidl, D.E., Jankowski, P. & Tsou, M.-H., 2015. Privacy and spatial pattern preservation in masked GPS trajectory data. International Journal of Geographical Information Science, 30(4), pp.785–800. Toucan by Lane F. Kinkade from the Noun Project https://thenounproject.com/term/toucan/166080

pyqgis_plugin.name: World Bank Data
pyqgis_plugin.description: Download and creates thematic maps with World Bank data.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Download and creates thematic maps with World Bank data.

pyqgis_plugin.name: HelloServer
pyqgis_plugin.description: This is a test plugin for the QGIS MapServer
pyqgis_plugin.about: This is a test plugin *** DO NOT USE IN PRODUCTION!!! ***. It provides various testing methods: - SayHello: just prints "HelloServer", no other processings, it can be used for speed testing with "ab" - RemoteConsole: a single user, single session completely insecure remote Python shell - RemoteConsole: execute Python code through a console web application - Watermark: adds a QGIS watermark to WMS images

pyqgis_plugin.name: FAOSTAT Data Downloader
pyqgis_plugin.description: Download FAOSTAT data to produce thematic maps.
pyqgis_plugin.about: FAOSTAT is maintained by the Statistics Division of the Food and Agricultural Organization of the United Nations. In working directly with the countries, the Statistics Division supports the development of national statistical strategies, the strengthening of Institution and technical capacities, and the improvement of statistical systems. The FAOSTAT system is one of FAO’s most important corporate systems. It is a major component of FAO’s information systems, contributing to the organization’s strategic objective of collecting, analyzing, interpreting, and disseminating information relating to nutrition, food and agriculture for development and the fight against global hunger and malnutrition. The FAOSTAT Data Downloader for QGIS uses the official FAOSTAT API to download statistical data and create vector layers with it.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Lattice Data
pyqgis_plugin.description: This is an example plugin for lattice data.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Calculated Moran's I for polygon layers and determines whether there is spatial correlation. It presents the scatter plot for the selected field. Require Pysal Library: https://github.com/pysal/pysal we copy folder pysal on library for Python QGIS "example C:\Program Files\QGIS Lyon\apps\Python27\Lib\site-packages".
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Andrea Castillo, Juan Carrillo, Diego Rodriguez

pyqgis_plugin.name: Transperator
pyqgis_plugin.description: Make black invisible in all raster layers
pyqgis_plugin.about: Convert black color (#000000) into transparent in all (grey level\ color) raster layers. The same as Layer properties->Transparency->Set 'Additional no data value' to `0`.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Geometry Exporter
pyqgis_plugin.description: The plugin displays the geometry of a selected feature as text. Supported formats: WKT, EWKT, GML2, GML3 and GeoJSON.
pyqgis_plugin.about: The plugin displays the geometry of a selected feature as text. The following formats are currently supported: WKT, EWKT, GML2, GML3, GeoJSON. Also adhoc conversion (e. g. Envelope, Centroid, ConvexHull, Boundary) and transformation (changing Coordinate Reference System) are supported.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Urban RadioCober
pyqgis_plugin.description: urban radiocober simulator plugin for omnidirectional radio coverage in urban enviroment
pyqgis_plugin.about: Urban RadioCober a plugin for Quantum GIS using the propagation model ITU -R 1238 that calculates the propagation losses and the impact of barriers on the radiated signal is. Similarly it illustrated the methodology, applying engineering design software for subsequent implementation in Python for QGIS PyQGIS.
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Mario Salazar, Leonardo Cifuentes, Jhon Castaneda

pyqgis_plugin.name: cReports
pyqgis_plugin.description: Creates customized reports from selected object in QGIS
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin allows you to generate customized reports from selected object in QGIS

pyqgis_plugin.name: PolygonSimplifier
pyqgis_plugin.description: A tool for simplifying polygons with preserving topology.
pyqgis_plugin.about: PolygonSimplifier can simplify polygons using the Ramer-Douglas-Peucker, the Visvalingam-Whyatt or the Whirlpool generalization algorithms. It is capable of preserving the topology during generalization.

pyqgis_plugin.name: QMetaTiles
pyqgis_plugin.description: Generate tiles(using metatiling) from QGIS project. Also provides a QGIS export for the LatLonGO mobile solution. Based on the QTiles plugin.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Generate tiles(using metatiling) from QGIS project. Also provides a QGIS export for the LatLonGO mobile solution. Based on the QTiles plugin.

pyqgis_plugin.about: Post treatment of open Telemac results (and Anuga as experimental). Requires matplotlib, shapely, numpy, scipy and networkx libraries.

pyqgis_plugin.name: OSMInfo
pyqgis_plugin.description: Get full information about a point from OpenStreetMap database.
pyqgis_plugin.about: For a selected point, extract all information abour nearby and enclosing features from OpenStreetMap database using Overpass API.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Place Marker
pyqgis_plugin.description: Place Marker provides a convenient way of adding placemarks to a vector layer.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Place Marker provides a quick and easy way of creating point layers and adding features with preset attributes. Unlike using the built-in editing tools, the created layer contains the necessary attributes, and newly added features are committed directly to the data store and should be available immediately on other QGIS instances. It addresses to usage scenarios where QGIS in conjunction with the "PosiView" plugin serves as an online visualization and navigation tool, e.g for scientific subsea surveys with remotely operated or autonomous vehicles. It allows marking and sharing interesting places and events during the dive.

pyqgis_plugin.name: CMaps Region Generator
pyqgis_plugin.description: Automate merging features using a CSV file definition.
pyqgis_plugin.about: CMaps Analytics Region Creator is a utility designed for typical business intelligence practitioners or dashboard developers to transform typical geographic administrative areas like zip, state, and country into custom business regions and territories.

pyqgis_plugin.name: GPX Velocity Calculation
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin calculates velocity along a GPX track
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin computes velocity along a GPX track from position and time

pyqgis_plugin.name: Serval
pyqgis_plugin.description: Map tool to set raster cell values.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Usage: The tool has 3 modes: probing, drawing and erasing. In the probing mode cell values are read and can be changed manually in a spinbox. In drawing mode, chosen pixel band values are written to disk. Erasing is assigning NoData value. For 3 bands rasters, native QGIS color picker can be used to define bands values.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Spatial Design Network Analysis
pyqgis_plugin.description: Allows use of the sDNA toolbox from QGIS
pyqgis_plugin.about: Allows use of the sDNA toolbox from QGIS. sDNA version 3.1 or above must be installed first from http://www.cardiff.ac.uk/sdna sDNA is a spatial network analysis tool with general applicability, but particularly suited to modelling urban networks. Standard sDNA currently calculates various measures of network density, gravity models, floating catchment, closeness, betweenness, convex hull and severance statistics. These can be based on different analysis metrics (Angular, Euclidean, Custom). Additional tools allow network preparation, statistical learning and prediction based on sDNA models. Analyses can be weighted or unweighted, and weights can be applied per polyline, link or unit length. An advanced version called sDNA+ is also available which can use arbitrary metrics from a user formula (hybrid metrics) as well as having presets for pedestrian, cyclist and vehicle use, and the ability to output analysis geometries (network radii, geodesics, convex hulls; one-to-one, one-to-many, one-to-all or all-to-all). Version 3.1 adds OD Matrix input and Skim Matrix output. Development of this plugin was funded by the ESRC Impact Accelerator grant "sDNA for all". The principal investigator was Alain Chiaradia and the co-investigator Crispin Cooper, based at Cardiff University department of Geography and Planning and the Sustainable Places Research Institute.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Azimuth Measurement
pyqgis_plugin.description: Just measure Azimuth when you draw a line
pyqgis_plugin.about: Plugin to display azimuth while drawing

pyqgis_plugin.name: GBIF Occurrences
pyqgis_plugin.description: Retrieve data from GBIF webservices (occurences API) directly within QGIS.
pyqgis_plugin.about: GBIF Occurrences is a QGIS plugin to directly download and import GBIF occurrence data from the application interface.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Qlr Browser
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin lets the user browse and open qlr files
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin enables a layer menu in a nested tree structure based on .qlr files. The layer tree is nested according to the location in folder/subfolder of the .qlr files. Development of this plugin has been funded by Haderslev Kommune and Frederikssund Kommune.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Wedge Buffer Processing Algorithm
pyqgis_plugin.description: Makes wedge shaped buffers on points
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin installs itself as a Processing algorithm which makes wedge shaped buffers on points. After installing the plugin, you have to activate its Processing provider under Processing -> Options -> Providers -> Wedge Buffer

pyqgis_plugin.name: Task Manager
pyqgis_plugin.description: Assign feature to a given user
pyqgis_plugin.about: Assign a feature to a given user. It depends on a PostgreSQL dabase that contains the user names.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Historical Map
pyqgis_plugin.description: Automatic vectorization of old forests from historical maps
pyqgis_plugin.about: Made by Nicolas Karasiak & Antoine Lomellini<br>Based on the work of Pierre-Alexis with the help of Mathieu Fauvel.<br><br>This plugin allow the user to filter an image (tif) with closing filter and median filter (you can set the parameters), then you can train with a shapefile of your perimeter, and to finish you get a shapefile with your selected class (ie: a shapefile of the forest from historical map, or of the vineyards...)<br><br><b>We suggest you to install SciKit-Learn before installing the plugin (or you will be forced to use GMM classifier and not KNN,RF or SVM).<br>For more information you can consult our tutorial at the <a href="https://github.com/lennepkade/Historical-Map/">Historical Map plugin page</a>.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Block Model
pyqgis_plugin.description: 3d block model tools
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin generates the surface exposure of three dimensional block models.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Geo Grid

pyqgis_plugin.about: Plugin GeoGrid build SHAPE files - geographic grid, and frame borders

pyqgis_plugin.name: Raster legend sensitive

pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin, show only in legend of raster, need have palette, the classes that inside map extent, and show and hide the classes of legend in the map. This plugin is developed on the demand of IBAMA(Brazilian Institute of Environment and Renewable Natural Resources) http://www.ibama.gov.br See the presentations: - http://pt.slideshare.net/LuizMotta3/qgis-ibama-rasterlegendsensitive

pyqgis_plugin.name: pointShifter
pyqgis_plugin.description: Shifts points for specified distance from nearest line segment according side attribute from point layer
pyqgis_plugin.about: Tool is used for define attribute information about position of input point and to fix this position according input line side attribute. It finds nearest link from Streets layer.Then find coordinates of point that is the end of perpendicular line from point to found street link and lies on the link. After it one calculates percent of length from reference node to this point on link and find coordinates of point, which lies on perpendicular from correct side (defined in input attribute "side") on defined in input parameter distance from street link.

pyqgis_plugin.name: flickr2qgis
pyqgis_plugin.description: import photos as shapefile from flickr
pyqgis_plugin.about: A plugin to search photos on flickr using a point, adress or region.

pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin takes in a field from a shapefile attribute table and loads all rasters given by the path.

The other tool can copy a bunch of images from a given source to the destiny chosen by the user. The user can select on QGIS the rectangles of the images that must be copied.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This is a set of two tools. One of them is used to assign tasks to analyst. The tasks are represented by rectangle features representing geographic zones. The other tool can copy a bunch of images from a given source to the destiny chosen by the user. The user can select on QGIS the rectangles of the images that must be copied.
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Alex Lopes Pereira, Bruno Alphonsus e José Mário Fraga Miranda

pyqgis_plugin.name: GIS Cloud Upload
pyqgis_plugin.description: Uploader to GIS Cloud
pyqgis_plugin.about: GIS Cloud Uploader *This tool is to be used in conjunction with a GIS Cloud account* API key - This tool requires the user to enter a GIS Cloud API Key as an input parameter. In order to generate an API Key log into your GIS Cloud account, click in the top right hand corner drop down menu Hi*Your Name*>>My Account. In the pop up box navigate to the far right tab API Access>> Add Key. This will produce a new API key, copy this key and keep it safe. To enter it into QGIS install this plugin and click on the tab Processing>>Options. Expand Providers>> GISCloud Uploader. Ensure the activate box is ticked, double click on the space below and paste in the GIS Cloud API Key - press enter. You will only need to do this once. Image Acknowledgement cloud up by Sherrinford from the Noun Project https://thenounproject.com/search/?q=cloud+up&i=62754

pyqgis_plugin.name: QGIS Server Browser
pyqgis_plugin.description: Simple QGIS Server WMS Browser
pyqgis_plugin.about: Adds a stylesheet to GetProjectSettings requests and creates a simple project browser with OpenLayers map preview.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Wincan 2 QGEP
pyqgis_plugin.description: Wincan 2 QGEP allows importing Wincan data into QGEP.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Wincan 2 QGEP allows importing pipe inspection TV data in Wincan format into waste-water network data, such as QGEP. Wincan is a software for the inspection and management of the waste water infrastructure (http://www.wincan.com/). The data respects the EN 13508 norm. You can browse inspection data and review each observation and choose what will be imported. Data will be imported into a QGEP project which has a data model respecting the Swiss-norm VSA-DSS.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Scipy Point Clustering
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin implements clustering for point data using the scipy module.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin implements point custering in scipy and add a label integer field to the feature class for the clustered data. Both hierarchical and k-means clustering are implemented. This is a Procesing plugin (actuvated automatically) and can be found in the processing toolbox. Please note that there are memory limitations in hierarchical clustering - the space required to create the clusters is O(n^2), which means that larger datasets will run out of memory fast. As such there is a plugin setting in the Processing options that sets the upper limit of points to process, by default set at 10,000. K-means is much more forgiving in terms of memory, so the limit is not enforced in those algorithms. All credit to the scipy team for the original implementation of the cluster algorithms. Jones E, Oliphant E, Peterson P, et al. SciPy: Open Source Scientific Tools for Python, 2001-, http://www.scipy.org/ [Online]. seagull by Lane F. Kinkade from the Noun Project https://thenounproject.com/term/seagull/166081

pyqgis_plugin.name: Polygons Parallel to Line
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin rotates polygons parallel to line
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin rotates all or only selected polygons within chosen distance (from line to polygon centroid) parallel to the nearest line segment if angle <= chosen angle value. May be useful when working with streets and buildings or with regular grids and buildings. If both angles between polygon edges and line segment <= 'Angle value', rotates by minimal angle value by default (can be change in settings to rotating by longer edge). Adds new field 'rotated' to polygonal layer. Rotated polygons takes value '1'.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Routes and Zones
pyqgis_plugin.description: Plugin RaZ is a wrapper for standard network analysis library in QGIS. Allows you to calculate a routes and zone of transport accessibility from one set of points to another set of points.
pyqgis_plugin.about: On the basis of user data, the plug-in solves two problems. The first task is to build routes from one group of point objects to other point objects group, subject to specified limits on the length of the route. To speed up the process, using the previously calculated return routes and recorded routes, previously ignored because it exceeded the length restrictions. The second task is the calculation of the areas transport accessibility of the specified length around an arbitrary group of point objects. Sample QGIS project file is in plugin subdirectory "sample-data". Use interface illustration file is "sample-data/illustration/sample use.png".

pyqgis_plugin.name: DWA M150 XML Import
pyqgis_plugin.description: Import Lines and Points (Manholes and sewers) from DWA XML 150
pyqgis_plugin.about: Import Lines and Points (Manholes and sewers) from DWA XML 150

pyqgis_plugin.name: Least Cost Path
pyqgis_plugin.description: This Plugin used to find the least-cost path between to location on DEM Surface using anisotropic accumulated-cost surface and A* algorithm.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This Plugin used to find the least-cost path between to location on DEM Surface using anisotropic accumulated-cost surface and A* algorithm. Anisotropic accumulated - cost surface algorithm used in this plugin reference to the algorithm described by Yu C., Lee J., and Munro-Stasiuk M J (2003) base on their journal (Yu C., Lee J., and Munro-Stasiuk M J., 2003, “Extensions to Least-Cost Path Algorithms For Roadway Planning”, International Journal of Geographical Information Science, Vol. 17, No. 4, hal. 361–376.). A* algorithm used in this plugin reference to Lester (2005) written on website ( www.policyalmanac.org/games/aStar.html)

pyqgis_plugin.name: QAD
pyqgis_plugin.description: Quantum Aided Design: cad like commands in QGIS
pyqgis_plugin.about: Quantum Aided Design: cad like commands in QGIS

pyqgis_plugin.name: Topographic Networks
pyqgis_plugin.description: Creation and analysis of topographic (surface) networks.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Terrain can be represented as a collection of objects - terrain features such as valleys, ridges, hills etc. One possible approach to arrive at such a model is modelling relationships between elements in a terrain model, most commonly pixels in an elevation model. Here, pixels are connected according to their height difference. Such a network, in its simplest form identical to the one used for watershed modelling, can then be analysed for modeling terrain ontologies...

pyqgis_plugin.name: DIVI QGIS Plugin
pyqgis_plugin.description: QGIS integration with DIVI system by GIS Support sp. z o.o. / Integracja QGIS z platformą DIVI firmy GIS Support sp. z o. o.
pyqgis_plugin.about: DIVI QGIS Plugin is extension for QGIS written in Python. It allows to view and edit data from DIVI system (http://divi.pl) created by GIS Support sp. z o. o. Plugin was created by GIS Support sp. z o. o. (http://www.gis-support.com) FEATURES: - Show assigned accounts, projects, layers and tables in list. - Load DIVI layers and tables to QGIS. - Load DIVI layers only of specified geometry type. - Load all layers from DIVI project. - Edit spatial data using standard QGIS tools: add/remove features, edit geometries and attributes, add/remove fields. - Edit DIVI layers/tables names. - Upload layers from QGIS directly to DIVI. ---- DIVI QGIS Plugin jest wtyczką do aplikacji QGIS, która służy do zarządzania danymi w systemie DIVI (http://divi.pl) firmy GIS Support sp. z o. o. Pozwala ona na przeglądać i edytować dane przestrzenne bezpośrednio w QGIS. Wtyczka została stworzona przez GIS Support sp. z o. o. (http://www.gis-support.pl) MOŻLIWOŚCI: - Wyświetlanie dostępnych kont, projektów oraz warstw i tabel w formie listy. - Dodawanie warstw i tabel DIVI do QGIS, każdy typ geometrii warstw (punkt, linia, poligon) wczytywany jest jako osobna warstwa. - Wymuszenie załadowania warstwy DIVI dla danego typu geometrii. - Wczytanie wszystkich warstw z danego projektu. - Edycja danych przestrzennych: dodawanie/usuwanie obiektów, edycja geometrii i atrybutów, dodawanie/usuwanie pól w tabeli atrybutów. Edycja odbywa się standardowymi narzędziami GIS. - Zmiana nazwy warstwy/tabeli DIVI. - Tworzenie nowych warstw DIVI poprzez przesłanie warstw QGIS. - Odświeżenie wczytanych danych poprzez ponowne ich pobranie z systemu DIVI.
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Piotr Pociask, GIS Support sp. z o. o.

pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin allows you to clip a shapefile into multiple shapefiles. Select an overlay shape and a shape to be clipped and the shape to be clipped will be clipped into a set of shapefiles, one for each polygon in the overlay.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Land Surface Temperature
pyqgis_plugin.description: This tool extracts land surface temperature from Landsat 5 TM, Landsat 7 ETM+ and Landsat 8 TIR imagery. It also calculates land surface emissivity by using the NDVI approach.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin has been written to estimate Land Surface Temperature (LST) from Visible, Near Infrared (NIR) and Thermal Infrared (TIR) imagery from Landsat 5 TM, Landsat 7 ETM+ and Landsat TIRS. The plugin has the ability to convert Digital Numbers (DNs) to Radiance, Radiance to brightness temperature, Calculate NDVI, estimate Land Surface Emissivity (LSE) and perform atmospheric and emissivity correction through the use of the Radiative Transfer Equation (RTE), Single Channel Algorithm (SCA), inversion of Planck function and the Mono Window Algorithm (MWA).

pyqgis_plugin.name: NextGIS Connect
pyqgis_plugin.description: Create, connect and use your own fully-functional Web GIS at nextgis.com.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Welcome to brand new cloud Web GIS from NextGIS! With this plugin you can upload/download geodata to and from your Web GIS, manage layers and much more. We'd love to hear feedback about your experience at http://nextgis.com/contact.

pyqgis_plugin.name: VetEpiGISstat

pyqgis_plugin.about:
VetEpiGIS-Stat is a member of VetEpiGIS QGIS plugin family. The goal of the development is to collect spatial statistical methods are used in veterinary epidemiology into a plugin and create an easy to use interface for their application. Implemented methods: global Moran's I, global Geary's c, Local Moran's I.
Developers: Norbert Solymosi from University of Veterinary Medicine, Budapest.
Contributors: Nicola Ferrè; Matteo Mazzucato; Paolo Mulatti; from Istituto Zooprofilattico Sperimentale delle Venezie (http://www.izsvenezie.it).

pyqgis_plugin.about: wps4server add OGC Web Processing Service capabilities to QGIS server

pyqgis_plugin.name: CUDA Raster
pyqgis_plugin.description: Utilize NVIDIA GPU to do raster calculations
pyqgis_plugin.about: **THIS PLUGIN IS ONLY TESTED TO WORK ON LINUX MACHINES. SEE CUDARaster_guionly FOR A STANDALONE GUI VERSION WHICH RUNS ON WINDOWS** This plugin uses CUDA enabled graphics cards to perform raster calculations. The QGIS GUI allows you to select an input file, output file and what kind of calculation you would like to do. This plugin currently supports reading and writing .asc files and .tif files. If you navigate to the plugin folder, it can also be used as a command line utility where multiple calculations can be run in one job. Note that while loading data from a raster layer already loaded into QGIS is supported, it often causes unexpected output -- loading from disk is always the more reliable option. See the README on our github page (github.com/aFuerst/PyCUDA-Raster) for more information on using the plugin as a command line utility separate from QGIS. CUDA 6.0 or higher, Boost.Python, Numpy, Python GDAL, and PyCUDA. Links to information about these dependencies can be found on the github page as well. You will need to make sure that the folder where you have installed CUDA is set to your path before starting QGIS and trying to install this plugin.
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Alex Feurst, Charles Kazer, William Hoffman

pyqgis_plugin.name: Image Footprint

pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin create a catalog layer from directories of images, how a memory layer, where each feature has metadata and footprint of a image. pyqgis_plugin.name: Export GML catastro de Espana

Choose ID field in layer FROM (for attributing resulting lines), 4. Choose ID field in layer FROM with IDs representing layer TO features, 5. Choose ID field in layer TO., 6. Run the tool.

pyqgis_plugin.name: VetEpiGISgroup
pyqgis_plugin.description: Spatial functions for veterinary epidemiology
pyqgis_plugin.about:
VetEpiGIS-Group is a part of VetEpiGIS plugin family helping veterinarian collaboration in the management of spatial data related to animal disease. It provides a set of functionalities to import/export and share data with other users, by allowing the creation of a working team (this would be based on SQLite db and/or Geoserver).
Developers: Norbert Solymosi from University of Veterinary Medicine, Budapest.
Contributors: Nicola Ferrè; Matteo Mazzucato; Paolo Mulatti; from Istituto Zooprofilattico Sperimentale delle Venezie (http://www.izsvenezie.it).

pyqgis_plugin.name: QGIS map styling GeoPackage extension

pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin reads and writes QGIS projects with related resources (e.g. images used in a print layout) in a GeoPackage file.

pyqgis_plugin.name: PDF Filler
pyqgis_plugin.description: Allows you to fill pdf forms with data from attribute table.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Requirements:<br> <br> - installed "fdfgen" module<br> - installed external program "pdftk server"<br> <br> For more information go to code repository site.<br> <br> ----------------------------------------------------<br> <br> WORKS FINE ON WINDOWS.<br> ON LINUX MAY CAUSES ERRORS (working on that).<br> OS X UNTESTED. PLEASE REPORT ISSUES.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Gban
pyqgis_plugin.description: Plugin that enables geocoding/reverse geocoding in France using the BAN API.
pyqgis_plugin.about: GBAN is a plugin for QGis that enables geocoding/reverse geocoding in France using the BAN API (https://adresse.data.gouv.fr/api/).

pyqgis_plugin.name: AnnotationManager
pyqgis_plugin.description: Panel to manage annnotations
pyqgis_plugin.about: Panel listing annotations and enable to hide/show it.

pyqgis_plugin.name: OAuthServer
pyqgis_plugin.description: This is a simple OAuth plugin for the QGIS MapServer
pyqgis_plugin.about: This is an highly experimental proof-of-concept plugin for QGIS Server that protects the server using OAuth2 for authorization (and delegated authentication).

pyqgis_plugin.name: wfsOutputExtension
pyqgis_plugin.description: Add Output Formats to WFS GetFeature request
pyqgis_plugin.about: wfsOutputExtension adds Output Formats to WFS GetFeature request.

pyqgis_plugin.name: QGIS2compat
pyqgis_plugin.description: A QGIS 3 compatibility layer for QGIS >= 2.8
pyqgis_plugin.about: a plugin that lets you write your python plugins code only once and gives you QGIS 2.8 - 3 and PyQt4 -5 support.

pyqgis_plugin.name: QMarxan Toolbox
pyqgis_plugin.description: Marxan Processing tools for QGIS
pyqgis_plugin.about: The QMarxan Toolbox is a replacment for QMarxanZ. The QMarxan Toolbox provides tools within the QGIS processing framework to prepare data and create input files for Marxan.

pyqgis_plugin.name: GNSS 3D Capture
pyqgis_plugin.description: This is a QGis plugin to measure 3D points from a GNSS connection
pyqgis_plugin.about: A plugin for capture 3D point from GNSS equipment
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: David Hernández López, Insittuto de Desarrollo Regional - UCLM
